src: Notalarning barchasini to'g'ri bosar ekansiz, qo'lingizning iloji boricha bo'shashganligiga ishonch hosil qiling — shuningdek, barmoqlaringiz bilan tegishli bo'lmagan harakatlarni ko'p qilmaslikka urining. Shu tarzda, siz o'zingizni imkon qadar kamroq toliqtirasiz. Unutmang, pianinodagi singari qo'shimcha kuch uchun klaviaturani katta kuch bilan urishga hojat yo'q. Akkordeonda qo'shimcha tovush chiqarish uchun ohangdan kuchliroq bosim yoxud tezlik bilan foydalanasiz.

This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: Kinofilmni DVD formatiga aylantirishda eng ko'p uchraydigan muammolardan biri bu tasvirni ortiqcha yoyib yuborishdir. Ko'pchilik televideniyelar keng ommaga yoqadigan tarzda tayyorlanadi. Ana shu sababli siz televizorda ko'radigan barcha narsalar yuqoridan, pastdan va yon tomonlardan kesilgan chegaralarga ega bo'ladi. Bu tasvir ekranni to'liq qoplashini ta'minlash uchun qilingan. Bu overskan deyiladi. Afsuski, DVDga yozganingizda uning chetlari ham kesilishi mumkin, agar videoda taglavha tag qismga juda yaqin joylashgan bo'lsa, ular ko'rinmaydi.
mt: 1 of the most common problems in converting a film to DVD is overscan. Most TV shows are produced in a way that looks good on TV. This means that the edges of the picture are cut off. This is done to fill the screen. Unfortunately, when you put it on a DVD, the edges can be cut off as well. If the credits are very close to the bottom of the screen, they may not be visible.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: Amerikaning rejasi uchta turli yo'nalishdan muvofiqlashtirilgan hamlalarni amalga oshirishga asoslangandi. General Jon Kadvalder har qanday qo'shimcha vositalarni to'sib qo'yish uchun Bordentaundagi ingliz garnizoniga qarshi chalg'ituvchi hujum boshlaydi. General Jeyms Eving Trenton Ferridagi daryodan 700 nafar militsiyani olib o'tdi, Assunpink daryosi ustidagi ko'prikni qo'lga kiritdi hamda hech bir dushman qo'shinining qochib qolishiga yo'l qo'ymadi. 2400 kishilik asosiy hujum kuchi Trentondan to'qqiz mil shimoldagi daryodan kesib o'tib, so'ng biri Grin qo'l ostida hamda yana biri Sallivan qo'l ostida tong otishiga yaqin hujum boshlash maqsadida ikki guruhga bo'lingan.
mt: The plan called for three coordinated attacks. General John Cadwalader launched a diversionary attack against the English garrison at Bordentown. General James Ewing brought 700 militiamen across the Delaware River at Trenton, captured the bridge over the Assunpink River, and blocked any retreat by the enemy force. The main attack force of 2400 men crossed the river at Trenton nine miles north of the main force, and attacked the English garrison at Green and Sullivan.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: "U 4-iyulda Kongress tomonidan qabul qilinganidan keyin, Kongress Prezidenti Jon Henkok va kotib Charlz Tomson tomonidan imzolangan qo'lyozma nusxasi keyinchalik bir necha blok naridagi Jon Dunlapning bosmaxonasiga yuborildi. Tun davomida 150 dan 200 ga qadar nusxalar tayyorlandi, ular hozirda ""Danlep yon zambaraklari"" deb ataladi. 8-iyul kuni Mustaqillik zali hovlisida hujjat Jon Nikson tomonidan birinchi marotaba ommaga o'qib berildi. Ularning bittasi 6-iyulda Jorj Vashingtonga yuborilgan va 9-iyul kuni Nyu-Yorkdagi lashkarlarga o'qib eshittirilgan. Bir nusxasi 10-avgustda London shahriga yetib borgan. Hali ham mavjudligi ma'lum bo'lgan 25 ta Dunlap plakatlari hujjatning eng eski saqlanib qolgan nusxasidir. Asl qo'lyozma saqlanib qolmagan."
mt: 4 July, the document was accepted by Congress, then signed by President John Hancock and Secretary Charles Thomson, was sent to John Dunlap's print shop a few blocks away. During the night, 150 to 200 copies were produced, which are now known as "Dunlap broadsides." On July 8, the Declaration was first read to the public by John Nixon in the Independence Hall courtyard. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, and read to the troops in New York on July 9. One reached London on August 10. Of the 25 known Dunlap broadsides, the oldest surviving copy is the original.
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: Mazkur faoliyatni ko'rgach, mustamlakachilar ham qo'shimcha kuchlarni chaqirdi. Oldingi pozitsiyalarni mustahkamlovchi qo'shinlar polkovniklar Jon Stark va Jeyms Rid (har ikkalasi ham keyinchalik general bo'lishgan) qo'l ostilaridagi 200 kishidan iborat 1 va 3-polklarni o'z ichiga oldi. Starkning odamlari mustamlakachi pozitsiyasining shimoliy yakunidagi panjara bo'ylab o'z o'rinlarini egalladilar. Quyi oqim yarimorolning shimoli-sharqi bo'ylab Mistik daryo yoqalab bo'shliq ochganida, ular tezda to'siqni qisqa tosh devor bilan kichik sohildagi suv havzasining shimoliy chekkasiga qadar kengaytirishdi. Gridli yoki Stark to'siq oldiga taxminan 100 fut (30 m) masofada ustun o'rnatib, oddiy odamlar o'tib ketgunicha hech kim o't ochmasligini buyurdi.
mt: Upon seeing this, the colonists also called for reinforcements. The garrison's previous positions were reinforced by the troops of colonels John Stark and James Reed (both of whom would later become generals). Stark's men took up positions along the northern end of the palisade. The lower stream of the Mystic River, which flowed through the northern end of the peninsula into a marshy area, was quickly widened by a short stone wall extending the barrier to the northern edge of the small pond. Stark placed a picket, or Stark's line, about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the barrier, and ordered no one to pass until the common people had passed through.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: Qadimiy Xitoy turli vaqt davrlarini ko'rsatishning noyob usuliga ega edi; Xitoyning har bir bosqichi yoki har bir hukmron oila aniq bir sulolaga bo'lgan. Shuningdek, har bir sulola orasida beqaror parokanda provinsiyalar davri bo'lgan. Bu davrlardan eng mashhuri Xan hamda Sin sulolalari o'rtasida 60 yil davomida yuz bergan Uch qirollik davridir. Bu davrlarda taxt uchun kurashayotgan zodagonlar o'rtasida shiddatli to'qnashuvlar bo'lib o'tdi. Uch qirollik Qadimgi Xitoy davridagi eng qonli davrlardan biri bo'lib, minglab odamlar Sian shahrida joylashgan hashamatli saroydagi taxtga o'tirish maqsadida kurashib halok bo'lgan.
mt: Ancient China had a unique way of marking its various time periods; each dynasty was associated with a specific clan. Additionally, each clan was followed by a period of interregnum, or "warring states". The most famous of these interregnums was the Three Kingdoms period between the Han and the Tang dynasties, which lasted for 60 years. This period was marked by intense fighting between the nobles vying for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest periods in Ancient China, with thousands of people dying in the fight for the throne in the luxurious palace in Sian.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: Chumoli koloniyalar armiyasi turli bosqichlarda ham yuradi va uya quradi. Ko'chish bosqichida chumolilar armiyasi tunda yuradi va kun davomida dam olish uchun to'xtashadi. Mavjud oziq-ovqat kamayganida koloniya ko'chmanchilik fazasini boshlaydi. Bu faza davomida koloniya har kuni o'zgaruvchi vaqtinchalik in quradi. Mazkur ko'chmanchi g'alayon yoxud yurishlarning har biri qariyb 17 kun davom etadi.
mt: Ant colonies move through different stages and build nests. In the moving stage, the ant army moves at night and rests during the day. When food is scarce, the colony enters the nomadic stage. In this nomadic stage, the colony builds a new nest every day. This nomadic stage lasts about 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: Fiziologiya va xulq-atvorda kuzatilgan ko'plab ritmlar ko'p hollarda endogen sikllar mavjudligi va ularning biologik soatlar orqali hosil bo'lishiga nihoyatda bog'liq. Tashqi davriy signallarga oddiygina javob bo'lmagan davriy ritmlar ko'plab tirik jonzotlar, jumladan, bakteriya, zamburug', o'simlik hamda hayvonlar uchun hujjatlashtirilgan. Biologik soatlar hattoki tashqi signallar bo'lmaganida ham avtonom harakatlanish davrini davom ettiruvchi avtogeneratordir.
mt: Many physiological and behavioral rhythms are closely related to endogenous cycles and are ultimately dependent on biological clocks. Rhythms that are not simply responses to external periodic signals have been documented in many living organisms, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self-sustaining oscillators that continue to cycle autonomously even in the absence of external signals.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: Populyatsiya berilgan geografik hudud doirasidagi ma'lum bir turlardagi organizmlar to'plamidir. Populatsiyaning barcha alohida vakillari aniq bir xususiyatga nisbatan bir xil bo'lgan hollarda ular monomorfik deb ataladi. Jismoniy shaxslarda muayyan xususiyatning bir qancha variantlari namoyon bo'lsa, ular polimorfikdir.
mt: A population is a collection of individuals of the same species living in a given geographic area. If all individuals of a population share a particular trait, they are said to be monomorphic. In physical individuals, if several variants of a trait are present, they are said to be polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: Tabiatga asoslangan turizm tabiat, jumladan, o'simliklar hamda hayvonlarning yovvoyi hayotidan zavqlanish maqsadida tabiiy hududlarga tashrif buyurishga qiziquvchi kishilarni o'ziga jalb qiladi. Joylardagi mashg'ulotlarga misol sifatida ov qilish, baliq ovlash, suratga olish, qushlarni tomosha qilish, bog'larga tashrif buyurish va ekotizim haqidagi ma'lumotlarni o'rganishni keltirish mumkin. Misol, Borneoga tashrif buyurib orangatuanglarni suratga olish va ularni o'rganishdir.
mt: Nature-based tourism is tourism that focuses on the natural environment, including wild plants and animals, for the purpose of enjoying nature. Activities include hunting, fishing, photography, birdwatching, visiting parks and learning about the environment. For example, visiting Borneo to photograph orangutans and study them.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: Har kuni ertalab odamlar avtomobillarda kichik shaharlarni tashlab ishga ketishar ekan, ular hozirgina ketgan joyda ishxonalari bo'lgan odamlar bilan kesishadilar. Mazkur dinamik transport marshrutida har bir kishi shaxsiy avtomashinaga asoslangan transport tizimi bilan qandaydir bog'liq va uni qo'llab-quvvatlaydi. Endilikda ilm-fan shuni ko'rsatib turibdiki, mazkur yirik uglerod iqtisodi biosferani o'zining oxirgi 2 mln. Yildan beri inson evolyutsiyasini qo'llab kelgan barqaror holatlarining biridan mahrum qilgan.
mt: Every morning people leave small towns in their cars to go to work, they meet people who have just left the place where they work. This dynamic transport route is based on a personal car-based transport system and is somehow related to it. Now science shows that this large carbon economy has deprived the biosphere of its last 2 million years of stable states that have supported human evolution.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: Atomni barcha moddalarning asosiy qurilish g'ishtlaridan biri deb hisoblasa bo'ladi. U Quyosh atrofida aylanayotgan sayyoralar singari Borning soddalashtirilgan modeliga asosan elektron orbitasi bo'ylab harakatlanayongan markaziy yadrodan tashkil topgan juda murakkab obyektdir — 1.1-rasmga qarang. Yadro ikkita zarrachalar — neytronlar va protonlarni o'z ichiga oladi. Neytronlar zaryadsiz, protonlar esa musbat elektr zaryadga ega. Elektronlarda manfiy elektr zaryadlar mavjud.
mt: 1.1: The atom is considered one of the basic building blocks of all matter. It is a very complex object, orbiting around the central nucleus, which is itself a very complex object, made up of orbiting neutrons and protons. Neutrons are uncharged, while protons are positively charged. Electrons have negative charges.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: Ayni vaqtda foydalaniladigan barcha kompyuterlar axborot manipulyatsiyasi ikkilik raqamlar shaklida kodlanishiga asoslangan. Ikkilik raqamlar faqatgina ikkita qiymatdan biriga ega bo'la oladi, misol uchun 0 yoki 1 hamda mazkur raqamlar kompyuter jargonida foydalanish uchun bitlar yoki ikkilik raqamlar deb yuritiladi.
mt: 0 or 1, and these are called bits or binary digits in computer jargon.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: "Bloglar talabalarning yozish mahoratini yaxshilashga ham yordam beradi. Talabalar ko'pincha o'z blog tajribasini pala-partish grammatika va imlo bilan boshlasa-da, auditoriyaning borligini odatda buni o'zgartiradi. Talabalar ko'p hollarda eng tanqidiy tinglovchilar bo'lganligi tufayli, bloger tanqiddan qochish uchun yozayotganlarini yaxshilashga intiladi. Shu bilan birga, blog yuritish ""talabalarni atrofidagi olam haqida yanada bilimli bo'lishga majburlaydi"". Ommadagi qiziqishni qanoatlantirish zarurati talabalarni fahmli hamda qiziqarli bo'lishga ilhomlantiradi (Toto, 2004). Blog yuritish hamkorlikka ilhomlantiruvchi va talabalarni an'anaviy o'qish kunidan tashqari bilimlarini kengaytirishga rag'batlantiradigan vositadir. Bloglardan to'g'ri foydalanish ""talabalarga yaxshiroq tahliliy va tanqidiy fikrlaydigan bo'lish imkonini beradi; Internet materiallarga faol javob berish orqali talabalar boshqalarning yozuvlari kontekstida o'z pozitsiyasini belgilashi, shuningdek, muayyan masalalar bo'yicha o'z nuqtayi nazarlarini bayon qilishi mumkin"". (Oravek, 2002)"
mt: "Blogs improve writing skills. Students often start their blogs with poor grammar and spelling, but the audience usually changes this. Students often write to avoid criticism because of the critical audience, but this also forces them to write better. Blogging also encourages collaboration and helps students to expand their knowledge outside of class. Proper use of blogs ""allows students to develop critical and analytical thinking; by responding to Internet materials, students can express their positions in the context of others' writings, and can articulate their own views on particular issues"". (Oravec, 2002)"
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: Asinxron aloqa mulohaza hamda boshqalarga reaksiya bildirish uchun vaqtni beradi. Bu talabalarga o'z sur'atida ishlash va o'quv ma'lumoti sur'atini nazorat qilish imkonini beradi. Bundan tashqari ish soatlarini moslashtirish mumkin bo'lgani holda vaqt cheklanishlari kamroqdir. (Bremer, 1998) Internet va Jahon tarmog'idan foydalanish ta'lim oluvchilarga ma'lumotlarni istalgan vaqtda olishlariga imkon beradi. Talabalar kunning har qanday paytida ustozlariga savol bera olishlari hamda keyingi yuzma-yuz uchrashuvni kutib o'tirgandan ko'ra, oqilona tez javoblarni kutishlari mumkin.
mt: Asynchronous communication allows for time to react to feedback. This allows students to manage their own pace and manage the pace of their learning. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows students to access information at any time. Students can ask questions of their instructors and wait for reasonable responses instead of waiting for face-to-face meetings.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: An'anaviy o'rta asrlar qal'asi ritsarlar turnirlari, banketlar va Artur rutsarligini qiyofalantirgan holda uzoq vaqtlar tasavvurlarni ilhomlantirib keldi. Hattoki ming yillik eski harobalar orasida turib ham uzoq o'tmishda o''tib ketgan janglarning tovushlari va hidlarini tasavvur qilish, toshlar ustida tuyoqlarning yurishlarini deyarli eshitish va zindon ostidan ko'tarilayotgan qo'rquvni sezish mumkin. Biroq bizning tasavvurimiz haqiqatga asoslanganmi? Nega birinchi navbatda qasrlar qurilgan? Ular qanday qilib loyihalashtirilgan va bunyod etilgan?
mt: The traditional medieval castle tournaments, banquets and the Arthurian legend have long inspired visions of the past. Even in the midst of ruins, it is possible to almost hear the sounds and smells of battles long past, to almost see the footsteps of feet on stones, and to almost feel the fear of being dragged out of a dungeon. But is our vision based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: o'sha davrga xos bo'lgan Kibri Muxloe qal'asi haqiqiy qal'adan ko'ra, ko'proq mustahkamligi oshirilgan uydir. Uning katta oynaband derazalari va ingichka devori keskin hujumga uzoq dosh berolmagan bo'lardi. 1480-yillarda qurilishi Lord Gastings tomonidan boshlangan vaqtda mamlakat nisbatan tinch bo'lgan va mudofaa izg'ib yurgan mayda qaroqchilar to'dalariga qarshi talab qilingan xolos.
mt: 1480s, the castle was built by Lord Hastings, who was in charge of the country at the time, and was relatively peaceful, and the small bandits were not required to be able to withstand a siege.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: Chorak mil yugurishdan yarim mil yugurishga otilganida tezlikning ahamiyatini ancha kamayadi va bardoshlilik mutlaq zaruriyatga aylanadi. Albatta, ikki daqiqani ishlab olishi mumkin bo'lgan birinchi darajali o'rta masofaga yuguruvchi sportchi juda katta tezlikka ega bo'lishi lozim, biroq nima bo'lganda ham chidamlilik rivojlantirilishi kerak. Qish paytida kross yugurish, tananing yuqori qismi uchun gimnastik mashqlar bilan birgalikda, yugurish mavsumi uchun eng yaxshi tayyorgarlikdir.
mt: As speed increases from a quarter mile to a half mile, speed becomes less important and endurance becomes a necessity. Of course, a sprinter in the middle distance must be very fast, but what is important is endurance. Cross-country running in the winter, gymnastics exercises for the upper body, and the best preparation for the running season.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: To'g'ri ovqatlanish amaliyotlarining o'zi a'lo ko'rsatkichlarni ta'minlay olmaydi, lekin ular yosh sportchilarning umumiy salomatligiga sezilarli ta'sir qila oladi. Sog'lom quvvat muvozanatini saqlash, foydali suv ichish odatiga amal qilish va qo'shimchalar iste'molining turli jihatlarini tushunish sportchilarga o'z ko'rsatkichlarini yaxshilash va sportdan ko'proq zavq olishlariga yordam beradi.
mt: Proper nutrition practices alone do not guarantee high performance, but they can have a significant impact on the overall health of young athletes. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, adhering to a habit of drinking water, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation can help athletes improve their performance and enjoy sports more.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: O'rta masofaga yugurish nisbatan arzon sport turi bo'lsa-da, u bilan shug'ullanish uchun zarur qancha anjom zarurligi borasida yanglish tushunchalar ko'p. Mahsulotlar ehtiyojga qarab sotib olinishi mumkin, biroq aksariyati faoliyatga arzimas ta'sir ko'rsatadi yoki umuman ta'sir ko'rsatmaydi. Atletlar hattoki haqiqiy foyda bermaganida ham, ular mahsulotni afzal ko'rishni his qilishlari mumkin.
mt: While middle-distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport, there are many misconceptions about what equipment is necessary to participate. Items can be purchased based on need, but most are either ineffective or ineffective altogether. Athletes may still prefer a product even if it is ineffective.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: "MRI 1930-yillarda Feliks Blok (Stenford universitetida ishlayotgan) va Edvard Pursell (Garvard universitetidan) tomonidan kashf qilingan yadro-magnit rezonansi (NMR) deb ataluvchi fizik hodisaga asoslangan. Bu rezonansda magnit maydon hamda radio to'lqinlar atomlarning ingichka radio signallarni yuborishiga sabab bo'ladi. 1970-yili tibbiyot shifokori hamda tadqiqotchi olim Raymond Damadian magnit-rezonans tomografiyadan tibbiy tashxis vositasi sifatida foydalanish asosini kashf etdi. To'rt yil o'tib, MRT sohasida chiqarilgan dunyodagi ilk patent berildi. 1977-yili doktor Damadian ilk ""butun tana"" MRT skanerini yaratishni yakunladi hamda uni ""Indomitable"" deb nomladi."
mt: 1930s, Felix Bloch (at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (at Harvard University) discovered the phenomenon of nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which is based on the interaction of a magnetic field and radio waves with atoms, causing them to emit tiny radio signals. In 1970, physician and researcher Raymond Damadian discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a diagnostic tool. Four years later, the first patent was issued in the field of magnetic resonance imaging. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the first "whole body" MRI scanner, which he named "Indomitable."
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: "MRI 1930-yillarda Feliks Blok (Stenford universitetida ishlayotgan) va Edvard Pursell (Garvard universitetidan) tomonidan kashf qilingan yadro-magnit rezonansi (NMR) deb ataluvchi fizik hodisaga asoslangan. Bu rezonansda magnit maydon hamda radio to'lqinlar atomlarning ingichka radio signallarni yuborishiga sabab bo'ladi. 1970-yili tibbiyot shifokori hamda tadqiqotchi olim Raymond Damadian magnit-rezonans tomografiyadan tibbiy tashxis vositasi sifatida foydalanish asosini kashf etdi. To'rt yil o'tib, MRT sohasida chiqarilgan dunyodagi ilk patent berildi. 1977-yili doktor Damadian ilk ""butun tana"" MRT skanerini yaratishni yakunladi hamda uni ""Indomitable"" deb nomladi."
mt: 1930s, Felix Bloch (at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (at Harvard University) discovered the phenomenon of nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which is based on the interaction of a magnetic field and radio waves with atoms, causing them to emit tiny radio signals. In 1970, physician and researcher Raymond Damadian discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a diagnostic tool. Four years later, the first patent was issued in the field of magnetic resonance imaging. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the first "whole body" MRI scanner, which he named "Indomitable."
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: Insonlar boshqalarning fikrlarini o'qish bo'yicha eng qobiliyatli turlardir. Bu bizning boshqa insonlar nimani idrok etishini, niyat qilishini, ishonishi, bilishi yoki xohlashini oldindan bashorat qila olishimizni anglatadi. Bu qobiliyatlar orasida boshqalarning maqsadini tushunish nihoyatda muhim. Bu jismoniy harakatlarning ehtimoliy noaniqlikarini hal etish imkonini beradi. Masalan, agar kimsa biror kimning avtomobil oynasini sindirayotganligini ko'rsangiz, siz u begonaning avtomobilini o'g'irlashga urinayotganligini taxmin qilgan bo'lardingiz. Agarda u avtomobilining kalitini yo'qotib qo'ygan bo'lsa hamda u buzib kirishga urinayotgan avtomobil o'ziniki bo'lsa, u boshqacha baholanishi kerak bo'lardi.
mt: Humans are the most adept at reading the minds of others. This means we can predict what others are thinking, intending, believing, knowing, or desiring. Among these abilities, understanding others' intentions is particularly important. It allows us to interpret the probabilistic ambiguity of physical actions. For example, if you see someone breaking a car window, you would likely assume that they are trying to steal the car. If they also lost the car keys and are trying to break into the car, you would likely assume otherwise. If the car is not theirs, you would likely assume even more.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: AI kuchli ilmiy fantastika mazmuniga ega bo'lsa-da, AI xulq-atvor, mashinada o'rganish va aqlli moslashish bilan shug'ullanadigan kompyuter fanlarining juda muhim sohasini tashkil qiladi. AI bo'yicha tadqiqotlar aqlli xatti-harakatlar talab etiluvchi vazifalarni avtomatlashtirish uchun mashinalar yaratishdan iborat. Nazorat, rejalashtirish va jadval tuzish, mijoz tashxislariga va savollariga javob berish qobiliyati hamda qo'lyozma, ovoz va yuzni tanib olish bunga misol bo'la oladi. Bu kabi haqiqiy hayotiy muammolarga yechim topishga qaratilgan narsalar alohida fanlarga aylangan. Hozirda bir qancha uy kompyuteri hamda video-o'yin dasturlari tarkibiga kiritilgani kabi, AI tizimidan iqtisot, tibbiyot, muhandislik hamda harbiy sohalarda tez-tez foydalaniladi.
mt: AI is a very important field of computer science that deals with intelligent behavior, learning, and adaptation of machines. Control, planning, and scheduling, answering user queries and questions, handwriting, speech and face recognition are examples of real-life problems that can be solved by AI. AI systems are used in many fields such as economics, medicine, engineering and military.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: Konvergent fikrlash namunalari — bu yechim topish uchun turli xil g'oyalarni yoxud sohalarni birlashtiradigan muammoni hal qilish usulidir. Tezkorlik, mantiq va aniqlik, shu bilan birga faktlarni aniqlash, mavjud texnikalarni qayta qo'llash, axborot yig'ish mazkur fikrlash tarzining asosiy yo'nalishidir. Mazkur fikrlash tarzining eng muhim omili bu: faqat bitta to'g'ri javob bor. Siz faqat ikkita javob, ya'ni to'g'ri yoki noto'g'ri haqida o'ylaysiz. Bu turdagi tafakkur muayyan bir fan yoki standart tartib-qoidalar bilan bog'liq. Bu tarzda o'ylaydigan insonlar mantiqiy tafakkurga ega bo'lib, namunalarni yodlab qolish, muammolarni yechish va ilmiy testlar ustida ishlashlari mumkin.
mt: 1. A convergent thinking example is a method of solving a problem by combining different ideas or fields. Speed, logic and accuracy, as well as identifying facts, reusing existing technology, and gathering information are the main focus of this type of thinking. The most important aspect of this type of thinking is that there is only one correct answer. You are not thinking of two answers, correct or incorrect. This type of thinking is related to a specific field or standard rules. People who think in this way are logical thinkers, can memorize examples, solve problems, and work on scientific tests.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: "Videoyozuvlardan foydalanish bir necha millisoniya davom etuvchi mikro-ifodalar va yuz harakatlarini talqin qilishda muhim kashfiyotlarga sababchi bo'ldi. Xususan, kichik ifodalarni to'g'ri talqin qilish orqali kishi yolg'on gapirayotgani yoki yolg'on gapirmayotganligini aniqlash mumkin, deya da'vo qilinmoqda. Oliver Saks ""Prezident nutqi"" maqolasida, miyadagi shikastlanish tufayli nutqni tushuna olmaydigan insonlarning qay tarzda samimiylikni aniq baholay olishini ko'rsatib o'tgan. U hattoki odam xulq-atrvorini talqin qilishdagi bunday qobiliyatlar uy itlari kabi hayvonlar tomonidan o'zlashtirilgan bo'lishi mumkin deb taxmin qilgan."
mt: "Video analysis has been key to the discovery of micro-expressions and facial movements that are crucial to the detection of deception. In particular, the ability to correctly interpret small expressions allows one to determine whether a person is lying or not. Oliver Sacks in his article "The President's Speech" demonstrated how people with brain damage are unable to understand speech, but can still detect sincerity. He even speculated that such abilities could be learned by animals such as dogs."
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: Bilim olish hamda o'rganish slohiyati yuqorida tilga olinganidek o'zgargani tufayli, bilim olishning bazaviy darajasi ham o'zgargan. Axborot olish bo'yicha yondashuv boshqacha edi. Individual eslash vaqtida ortiq bosim bo'lmas edi, biroq matnni eslash qobiliyatiga ko'proq e'tibor qaratila boshlagandi. Aslini olganda, Uyg'onish davri o'rganish hamda bilim berishga nisbatan bo'lgan yondashuvda katta o'zgarishlar qildi.
mt: Because of the shift in the way we learn and understand, the basic level of learning has changed. The approach to information gathering was different. There was not too much pressure to remember the text at the time of individual reading, but more attention was paid to the ability to remember the text. In fact, there were great changes in the way of awakening and learning and teaching.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: "Internet o'zida ommaviy hamda shaxslararo aloqa elementlarini mujassamlashtiradi. Internetning alohida xususiyatlari undan foydalanish hamda mamnun etuvchi yondashuv borasida qo'shimcha o'lchamlarga yetaklaydi. Misol uchun, ""ta'lim"" va ""ijtimoiylashuv"" internetdan foydalanish uchun muhim motivatsiyalar sifatida taklif qilinadi (Jeyms va boshqalar, 1995). Auditoriyaning vebsaytlarga munosabatini tadqiq qilganlarida, Eymey va Mak-Kord (1998) tomonidan ""shaxsiy ishtirok"" va ""davomiy munosabatlar"" ham motivatsiyaning yangi jihatlari deb topilgan."
mt: "The Internet embodies the elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The unique characteristics of the Internet lead to additional measures of use and satisfaction. For example, "education" and "socialization" are suggested as important motivations for using the Internet (James et al., 1995). In their examination of audience reactions to websites, Eymey and MacKord (1998) found new dimensions of motivation in "personal involvement" and "continuing relationships."
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: Gotik uslub 10–11-asrlar va 14-asr oralig'ida o'z cho'qqisiga chiqqan. Dastlab ko'ylakka sharqdagi Vizantiya madaniyati kuchli ta'sir ko'rsatdi. Ammo aloqa kanallarining sekinligi sababli g'arbdagi uslublar 25 yildan 30 yilgacha ortda qolgan bo'lishi mumkin. o'rta asrlarning oxiriga kelib g'arbiy Yevropa o'z uslubini yaratishni boshladi. Salb yurishlari natijasidagi o'sha vaqtdagi eng katta rivojlanishlardan biri, odamlar kiyimlarni mahkamlash uchun tugmalardan foydalana boshladilar.
mt: 10th and 11th centuries and the 14th century Gothic style reached its peak. Initially influenced by the Byzantine culture of the East, the style was slow to reach the West, possibly taking 25 to 30 years to arrive. By the end of the Middle Ages, Western Europe began to develop its own style. One of the most significant developments of the time, people began to use buttons to fasten their clothing.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: Biz atrof-muhitga nisbatan yana do'stona hayot kechirishni boshlashimiz, atrof-muhitni himoya qilish harakatiga qo'shilishimiz hamda hattoki kelgusidagi azob-uqubatlarni muayyan darajada kamaytirish uchun faol bo'lishimiz ham mumkin. Bu ko'pincha xuddi simptomatik davolashga o'xshab ketadi. Lekin agar biz faqatgina vaqtinchalik yechimni xohlamasak, unda muammolarning ildizini topishimiz hamda ularni faolsizlantirishimiz lozim. Dunyoda insoniyatning ilmiy va texnikaviy yutuqlari tufayli katta o'zgarishlar yuz bergani va aholining haddan ortiq ko'payishi hamda insoniyatning isrofgar turmush tarzi sababli muammolarning yanada kattalashgani hammaga ayon.
mt: We can still live a life of comfort and ease, join the environmental movement, and even help reduce future suffering. This is often like symptomatic treatment. But if we don't want a temporary fix, we need to find the root of the problems and neutralize them. There have been great changes in the world due to the scientific and technological achievements of mankind, and the overpopulation of the world and the wasteful lifestyle of mankind have made the problems worse for everyone.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: Kuchlar muvozanati Yevropa mamlakatlari barcha Yevropa davlatlarining milliy suverenitetini saqlashga harakat qilgan tizim edi. Konsepsiya Yevropaning barcha davlatlari bir davlatning qudratli bo'lishing oldini olishga intilishlaridan iborat edi va shu tarzda milliy hukumatlar muvozanatni saqlash maqsadida o'z ittifoqlarini tez-tez o'zgartirib turardilar. Ispaniya merosi uchun urush kuchlar muvozanati asosiy muammosi bo'lgan birinchi urushni belgilab berdi. Bu muhim o'zgarish bo'ldi, chunki Yevropaning qudratli davlatlari endi diniy urushni bahona qila olmas edi. Shu tarzda, diniy urush deb nomlangan o'ttiz yillik urush oxirgi urush bo'ldi.
mt: The balance of power was a system that aimed to preserve the sovereignty of all the national governments of Europe. The concept was that no nation should be too powerful and that national alliances should be frequently changed in order to preserve the balance. The Spanish Succession was the first war to be caused by the balance of power. This was a major change, because the powerful nations of Europe could no longer use religion as an excuse for war. Thus, the war called the War of Religion was the last war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: Kuchlar muvozanati Yevropa mamlakatlari barcha Yevropa davlatlarining milliy suverenitetini saqlashga harakat qilgan tizim edi. src: Yevropa tarixining mazkur davrida boylik va qudratga erishgan Katolik cherkovi qattiq tekshiruv ostida qoldi. Xristian dini til va urf-odatdagi farqlarga qaramasdan, Yevropa davlatlarini ming yillar davomida bir-biri bilan bog'lab kelgan. Uning keng qamrovli qudrati shohdan tortib, oddiy insongacha ta'sir qildi. Nasroniylikning asosiy tamoyillaridan biri, boylik azob-uqubatlar hamda qashshoqlikni yengillashtirish uchun kerak va cherkovning pul mablag'lari aynan ana shu maqsad yo'lida qo'llanishidir. Cherkovning markaziy hokimiyati ming yildan beri Rimda bo'lib kelmoqda, qudrat va mablag'ning bunday jamlanishi ko'pchilikni bu qoidaning bajarilayotgan yoki bajarilmayotganligini savol ostiga qo'yishiga olib keldi.
mt: In the history of Europe, the Catholic Church has been under intense scrutiny. Despite the differences in language and culture, Christianity has been the unifying force in European states for centuries. Its influence has extended from kings to commoners. One of the main principles of Christianity is that wealth should be used to alleviate poverty and the Church's resources are used for this purpose. The central authority of the Church has been in Rome for a thousand years, and the concentration of power and resources has led many to question whether the principle is being carried out or not.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: Dahshatga tushgan qirol Lyudovik XVI, qirolicha Mari Antuanetta, ularning ikki nafar yosh farzandi (11 yoshli Mari Tereza hamda to'rt yoshli Lui-Charlz) hamda qirolning singlisi, Yelizaveta xonim, 1789-yilning 6-oktyabrida bozorchi ayollar olomoni tomonidan Versaldan Parijga majburan qaytarilgan. Ular aravada shoh va malikaga qarshi tahdidlarni aytib qichqirayotgan va baqirayotgan odamlar to'dasi bilan birgalikda Parijga qaytib keldilar. Olomon qirol va qirolichani o'z aravalarining derazalarini katta ochishga majbur qilishdi. Bir vaqt olomonning bir a'zosi Versalda qatl qilingan qirol tansoqchisining boshini dahshat og'ushidagi qirolichaning oldida silkidi.
mt: 6 October 1789: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette, their two young children (11-year-old Marie-Thérèse and four-year-old Louis-Charles) and the king's sister, Élisabeth, were forcibly returned from Versailles to Paris by a mob of market women. They were escorted in a carriage with the women shouting and screaming threats against the king and queen. The mob forced the king and queen to open the windows of their carriages. One of the mob threw the severed head of the king's executioner, who had been beheaded at Versailles, in front of the terrified queen.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: Harbiy harakatlar xurujidan ko'p o'tmay, Britaniya Germaniyani dengizda blokada qilishni boshladi. Garchi ushbu blokada o'tgan ikki asrning bir nechta xalqaro shartnomalari bilan kodifikatsiya qilingan umumqabul qilingan xalqaro huquqni buzsa-da, strategiya samarali bo'ldi, u muhim harbiy va fuqarolik ta'minotini uzib qo'ydi. Britaniya hattoki neyral kemalarga ham xavf tug'dirib, har qanday kemaning butun okean qismlariga kirishining oldini olish maqsadida xalqaro suv hududlarini minalashtirdi. Mazkur taktikaga nisbatan cheklangan javob bo'lgani tufayli Germaniya o'zining cheklanmagan suvosti urushiga o'xshaydigan javob kutgandi.
mt: The British began a naval blockade of Germany shortly after the outbreak of hostilities. Although this blockade violated several international treaties codified in the last two centuries of accepted international law, the strategy was successful, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies. The British even threatened neutral ships, preventing any ship from entering the entire oceanic regions, by mining international waters. The British responded with a limited response to this tactic, as Germany responded with a similar unrestricted submarine warfare.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: Butun Amerika Qo'shma Shtatlari bo'ylab taxminan 400 000 ta parishonxotirlik sklerozi (MS) holatlari ma'lum bo'lib, bu yoshroq va o'rta yoshdagi kattalar orasida yetakchi nevrologik kasallik bo'lib qolmoqda. MS — miya, orqa miya hamda optik asab tolalaridan iborat markaziy asab tizimiga ta'sir ko'rsatuvchi xastalikdir. Tadqiqotda ayollarning MS darajasini olish ehtimoli ikki marta balandligi aniqlandi.
mt: 400,000 cases of multiple sclerosis (MS) are known to exist across the United States, making it the leading neurological disease among young and middle-aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, including the brain, spinal cord, and optic nerves. Research has found that women are twice as likely to contract MS.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: Tadqiqotda tushkunlik, qo'rquv va vahima bel og'rig'idan aziyat chekuvchilarda og'riq va nogironlik o'rtasidagi munosabatga vositachilik qilishi aniqlandi. Tushkunlik va qo'rquv emas, faqatgina halokatlashtirishning ta'sirlari haftalik qilib tuzilgan muntazam PA seanslarining sharti edi. Domiy faoliyat ishtirokchilariga surunkali og'riqdagi farqlar va odatiy jismoniy harakatdan noqulaylik hissini ajratib turuvchi og'riqning salbiy qabul qilinishi nuqtai-nazaridan ko'proq ko'makni talab qilindi.
mt: The study found that depression, anxiety and panic disorder patients who received weekly, routine PA sessions were more likely to report pain and difficulty with normal physical activity than those who did not.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: Zamonaviy qilichbozlik sporti universitetda tahsil olayotgan talabalardan tortib, professional va Olimpiada o'yinlarigacha ko'plab darajalarda o'ynaladi. Bu sport asosan duel shaklida o'ynaladi, bir qilichboz boshqasi bilan jang qiladi.
mt: Modern fencing is played by students in university, professionals and Olympic athletes at many levels. This sport is mainly played in duel form, one fencer fights another.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: Ichki zaharlanish darhol bilinmasligi mumkin. Qayt qilish kabi alomatlar darhol tashxis qo'yish mumkin bo'lmagan umumiy belgilardir. Dori vositasi yoki uyda foydalaniluvchi zaharli kimyoviy moddalarning ochiq idishda qolganligi ichki zaharlanishga yaxshi misol bo'lishi mumkin. Mazkur maxsus zahar uchun maxsus birinchi tibbiy yordam ko'rsatmalari yorlig'ini tekshiring.
mt: Signs of internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. General symptoms such as vomiting and diarrhea may not be indicative of internal poisoning. The presence of a drug or household chemical in an open container in the home may be indicative of internal poisoning. Consult the first aid instructions for the specific poison.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: Qurbonni tekshirish uchun siz xavfsizligingizga ishonch hosil qilish maqsadida avval voqea sodir bo'lgan joyni o'rganishingiz kerak. Jabrlanuvchiga yaqinlashganingizda uning (erkak yoki ayol) holatini va har qanday avtomatik xavf alomatlarini payqashingiz kerak. Agar siz yordam berishga urinib jarohat olsangiz, vaziyatni yanada og'irlashtirish uchungina xizmat qilishingiz mumkin.
mt: To assess the situation, you must first approach the scene of the incident with confidence in your safety. You must be able to determine the victim's (male or female) condition and any automatic danger signs. If you try to help and get injured, you may only make the situation worse.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: Metrik tizimni qo'llash, absolyutizmdan respublikachilikka o'tish, millatchilik va davlatning yakka hukmdorga emas, xalqqa tegishli ekani haqidagi aqida kabi ko'plab ijtimoiy va siyosiy ta'sirlar bor. Shuningdek, inqilobdan keyin kasblar barcha erkak nomzodlarga ochiq bo'lib, eng shuhratparast va omadlilarga muvaffaqiyat qozonish imkonini berardi. Bu harbiylarga ham taalluqli bo'lgan, chunki armiya reytingi sinflar bo'yicha emas, endi kaliberga asoslanadigan bo'ldi. Fransuz inqilobi boshqa mamlakatlarning zulm ostidagi boshqa ko'plab ishchi sinf vakillarini ham o'z inqiloblarini boshlashga ilhomlantirdi.
mt: 1. Metric system, 2. From absolutism to republicanism, 3. Belief that the state belongs to the people, not to a single ruler, 4. All professions were open to all male candidates, the most famous and successful were more likely to succeed, 5. This also applied to the military, where the ranking was no longer based on class, but on calibre, 6. The French Revolution inspired other oppressed classes in other countries to start their own revolutions.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: Har bir odam jamiyat ishtirokchisi bo'lib, transport tizimlarini qo'llaydi. Deyarli barcha odamlar transport tizimlaridan noliydilar. Taraqqiy etgan davlatlarda siz ichimlik suvining sifati yoki ko'priklarning buzilib tushishiga oid bu kabi shikoyatlarga kamdan-kam guvoh bo'lasiz. Nima uchun transport tizimlari bunday shikoyatlarni paydo qiladi, nima uchun ular har kuni xatolar qilishadi? Transport muhandislari shunchaki malakasizmi? Yoki yanada muhimroq nimadir bormi?
mt: Each person is a member of society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone uses transportation systems. In developed countries you rarely hear complaints about the quality of your drinking water or bridges collapsing. Why do transportation systems generate such complaints, why do they fail every day? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more important going on?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: Yo'l harakati oqimi – ikki nuqta orasidagi alohida haydovchilar hamda transport vositalarining harakatlari va ularning bir-birlariga nisbatan o'zaro aloqalarini o'rganishdir. Afsuski, qatnov oqimini o'rganish mashaqqatli, chunki haydovchining xatti-harakatlarini yuz foiz aniqlik bilan oldindan aytib bo'lmaydi. Yaxshiki, haydovchilar o'zini oqilona izchil doirada tutishga moyil; shu sababli qatnov oqimlari bir oz oqilona izchillikka ega va matematik jihatdan taxminan ifodalanishi mumkin. Tarfik oqimini yaxshiroq ifodalash uchun uch asosiy xususiyat orasida quyidagi aloqalar o'rnatildi: (1) oqim, (2) zichlik hamda (3) tezlik. Mazkur munosabatlar yo'l obyektlarini rejalashtirish, loyihalash hamda eksplutatsiya qilishga ko'maklashadi.
mt: Traffic flow is the study of individual vehicles moving or being moved along a specific route. Unfortunately, the behavior of a driver cannot be predicted with 100% accuracy. However, drivers tend to behave in a predictable manner, and traffic flows tend to be predictable, and can be modeled mathematically. Three basic relationships are used to better model traffic flow: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) speed. These relationships help in planning, designing, and exploiting roadways.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: DNK genetik material ekanligi Xershey va Cheyz tajribasining asosiy taxminlaridan biri edi. Xershi va Cheyz o'z DNKlarini bakteriyaga ko'chirib o'tkazish uchun faglar yoki viruslardan foydalangan. Ular ham fagdagi DNKni radioaktiv fosfor bilan, ham fagning oqsilini radioaktiv oltingugurt bilan belgilab olib, ikki eksperimentni amalga oshirdi.
mt: 1 of the main hypotheses of the Hershey and Chase experiment was that DNA was the genetic material. Hershey and Chase transferred their DNA into bacteria using phages or viruses. They labeled the DNA in the phage with radioactive phosphorus and the protein in the phage with radioactive sulfur, and performed two experiments.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: Mutatsiyalar mutatsiya turi, ta'sirlangan genetik material bo'lagining ahamiyati va ta'sirlangan hujayralar jinsiy hujayralar ekani yoki yo'qligiga qarab turli xil ta'sirga ega bo'lishi mumkin. Faqatgina jinsiy hujayralardagi mutatsiyalar bolalarga o'tishi mumkin, boshqa har qanday yerdagi mutatsiyalar hujayraning nobud bo'lishi yoki saratonga sabab bo'lishi mumkin.
mt: Mutations can have different effects depending on the type of mutation, the importance of the genetic material affected, and whether the affected cells are sex cells or not. Only mutations in sex cells can be passed on to children, other mutations can lead to the cell's death or cancer.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: Echkilar ilk bor 10 ming yilcha avval Eronning Zagros tog'larida qo'lga o'rgatilgan ko'rinadi. Qadimgi madaniyatlar hamda qabilalar ularni sut, jun, go'sht va terilardan oson qo'lga kiritish maqsadida saqlay boshlaganlar. Xonaki echkilar odatda tepaliklar yoki boshqa boqish joylarida o'tlab yuradigan podalarda saqlanardi, ular ko'p hollarda ommaga yaxshiroq tanish bo'lgan cho'ponga o'xshash echkiboqarlar tomonidan boqilgan va ular ko'pincha bolalar yoki o'smirlar bo'lgan. Chorvachilikning mazkur usullaridan bugungi kunda ham foydalaniladi.
mt: 10,000 years ago, domestication of sheep first appeared in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, wool, meat and skins. Wild sheep were usually kept in herds on hills or other grazing grounds, and were often tended by herders resembling the better known shepherds. These methods are still used today.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: Golf — bu o'yinchilar koptoklarni urib, chuqurchalarga tushirish uchun klyushkalardan foydalanadigan o'yindir. Odatiy raund davomida o'n sakkizta chuqurcha o'ynaladi, o'yinchilar odatda yo'lakdagi birinchi chuqurchadan boshlashadi va o'n sakkizinchisida tugatishadi. Bosqichni yakunlash uchun eng kam chavgon zarbalari yoxud tebranishlaridan foydalangan o'yinchi g'alaba qiladi. o'yin o't ustida o'ynaladi va chuqurcha atrofidagi o'tlar qisqaroq qilib o'rilib, yashil deb nom beriladi.
mt: Golf is a game in which players hit balls with clubs into holes in the ground. A typical round consists of eighteen holes, and players usually begin at the first hole and end at the eighteenth. The game is won by the player who completes the course in the fewest strokes. The course is played on grass, and the grass is cut shorter around the holes, which are called greens.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: Ilm-fanning asosiy maqsadi ilmiy usul orqali dunyoning qanday ishlashini aniqlashdir. Aslini olganda, bu usul boshqa ko'plab ilmiy izlanishlarga yo'lboshchilik qiladi. Biroq bu faqatgina tajribalar emas va tajriba — bu mumkin bo'lgan bir yoki bir nechta gipoteza, masalaning qo'yilishi va ilmiy tadqiqotlar uchun oriyentir bo'lib ham xizmat qiluvchi kuzatuvlarni o'tkazishni istisno qilish uchun foydalaniluvchi testdir.
mt: The primary purpose of science is to understand how the world works through the scientific method. In fact, this method is used in many other scientific investigations. But this is not just experiments, but also experiments — a possible one or more hypotheses, for example, to be used as a guide for scientific research and to exclude observations for testing.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: Tornadolar, boshqa kuchli bo'ronlar bilan taqqoslaganda, kichik hududga zarba beradi, ammo yo'lida uchragan har qanday narsani vayron qilishi mumkin. Tornadolar daraxtlarni ildizi bilan qo'porib tashlaydi, binolardan taxtalarni sug'urib oladi va avtomobillarni osmonga uchiradi. Tornadolarning eng kuchli ikki foizi uch soatdan ko'proq davom etadi. Bu dahshatli bo'ronlarda shamolning tezligi 480 km/soatgacha (133 m/s; 300 milya/soat) yetadi.
mt: Tornadoes, compared to other strong storms, can strike a small area, but anything in their path can be leveled. Tornadoes rip trees out by the roots, toss cars like corks, and tear buildings apart. Two percent of tornadoes last more than two hours. Winds in these terrifying storms can reach 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: Insonlar ming-minglab yillar davomida kattalashtirish uchun linzalar ishlab chiqarishmoqda va foydalanib kelishmoqda. Biroq birinchi haqiqiy teleskoplar Yevropada XVI asrning oxirlarida yaratildi. Ushbu teleskoplarda olisdagi obyektlarni yaqinroq va kattaroq ko'rsatish uchun ikkita linza kombinatsiyasidan foydalanilgan.
mt: People have been making and using lenses to magnify things for thousands of years. But the first real telescopes were created in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make objects appear closer and larger.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: "Muhammad bu dunyo hayotidan tashqarida bo'lgan masalalarga chuqur qiziqqan. U tafakkur yuritish uchun ""Nur"" (yorug'lik) tog'idagi ""Hiro"" nomi bilan tanilgan g'orga tez-tez borib turgan. Zamonlar osha butun qolib kelgan g'orning o'zi Muhamamad kechirgan ruhiy moyilliklarning yorqin tasvirini beradi. Makkaning shimolidagi tog'lardan birining ustida joylashgan mazkur g'or dunyoning qolgan qismidan butunlay ajratilgan. Aslida, hatto agar kimdir uning mavjudligini bilganida ham, uni topish umuman oson emas. g'orning ichiga kirish, bu butunlay yakkalanishdir. Tepadagi tiniq, go'zal osmon va atrofdagi ko'plab tog'lardan boshqa hech narsa ko'rinmaydi. g'or ichida bu dunyoning juda kichik qismini ko'rish yoki eshitish mumkin."
mt: "Muhammad was very interested in matters beyond this world. He often went to the mountain called "Hiro" (light) on the "Nur" (light) mountain for contemplation. The timelessness of the mountain where Muhammad spent his spiritual inclinations is vividly depicted. This cave is located on a mountain in the north of Mecca. In fact, even if someone knew it existed, it would be difficult to find. Entering the cave is complete isolation. The pure, beautiful sky and the surrounding mountains are the only things visible. It is possible to see or hear a very small part of this world in the cave."
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: Vagon yo'llari Angliyada 16-asrdayoq barpo etilgan. Vagon yo'llari shunchaki parallel yog'och plankalaridan tashkil topganligiga qaramasdan, ular tortish otlarga kattaroq tezlikka erishish va o'sha kunlardagi bir oz notekis bo'lgan yo'llariga nisbatan kattaroq yuklarni tortish imkonini berdi. Temir yo'llar shpallari juda erta o'ylab topildi. Lekin agar ularning ustida temir ham bo'lsa, temir yo'llar yanada foydali bo'lishini sekin-astalik bilan anglab yetdilar. Bu umumiy amaliyotga aylangan, biroq temir vagonlarning yog'ochdan yusalgan g'ildiraklarining ko'proq yemirilishiga olib kelgan. Vaqti kelib, yog'och g'ildiraklarning o'rnini temir g'ildiraklar egalladi. 1767-yilda dastlabki to'liq temir relslar ishlab chiqarildi.
mt: 16th century England saw the first wagonways. Wagonways were simply parallel wooden planks, but they allowed greater speeds than the tortoise-like oxen and the rough roads of the day could manage, and they could haul greater loads. The idea of rails was soon thought of. But if they were made of iron, then railroads would be even more useful, it was slowly realized. This became common practice, but the wooden wheels of iron wagons wore out more quickly. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. The first full iron rails were produced in 1767.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
