src: Romantizmda Gyote, Fixte hamda Shlegel singari yozuvchilardan qolgan madaniy determinizmning yirik elementi bor edi. Romantizm nuqtai-nazaridan geografiya shaxslarni shakllantirdi, vaqtlar o'tishi bilan o'sha geografiyaga bog'liq bo'lgan odatlar va madaniyat yuzaga keldi, bular jamiyatdagi o'rin bilan uyg'un bo'lgan holda o'zboshimchalik bilan kiritilgan qonunlardan yaxshiroq edi.
mt: In the romantic view, geography shaped individuals, and over time, customs and culture emerged that were in harmony with the place, and were better than arbitrary laws imposed.
ref: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.

src: "Texnologik determinizm — bu texnologik turtki yoki texnologik zaruratdan tortib, inson taqdiri ilmiy qonunlar va ularning texnologiyalardagi aksi bilan bog'liq asosiy mantiq tomonidan boshqariladi degan qat'iy tushunchagacha bo'lgan amaliyotdagi g'oyalarning keng doirasini qamrab oluvchi atamadir. Texnologik determinizmning aksariyat tavsiflari ikki umumiy g'oyani o'zida mujassam etadi: texnologiya rivojlanishining o'zi asosan siyosiy yoki madaniy ta'sirdan tashqaridagi yo'ldan boradi va texnologiyaning, o'z navbatida, ijtimoiy shartli emas, aksincha, o'ziga xos bo'lgan jamiyatlarda ""ta'sirlari"" mavjud. Masalan, motorli avtomobil mos ravishda yo'llarning yaxshilanishiga sabab bo'la oladi, deyish mumkin. Ammo davlat miqyosidagi yo'l tarmog'i faqat bir qancha avtomobillar uchungina iqtisodiy jihatdan yashovchan emas, shu sababli avtomobillarga egalik narxini pasaytirish maqsadida ishlab chiqarishning yangi usullari ishlab chiqilgan. Ommaviy ravishda avtomobilga ega bo'lish yo'llardagi halokatlarning ko'payishiga ham olib keladi, bu esa sog'liqni saqlash sohasida shikastlangan tanalarni tuzatish uchun yangi usullarning ixtiro qilinishiga yetaklaydi."
mt: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of practical beliefs about the relationship between technology and society, from the idea that technology is driven by its own internal logic or necessity, to the idea that human destiny is governed by scientific laws and their technological applications. Most descriptions of technological determinism embody two common assumptions: that the development of technology is largely independent of political or cultural influence, and that technology has its own "effects" on society, for example, that motorized vehicles can improve roadways. For example, a road network can only be economically viable for a few automobiles, so new methods of production are developed to lower the cost of automobiles. The proliferation of automobiles also leads to increased road accidents, which in turn leads to the development of new methods of treating injured bodies."
ref: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."

src: """Yuqori kamonsimon"" belgi V ga o'xshaydi va ""pastki kamonsimon belgi"" pastki tarafi tushirib qoldirilgan kvadratga yoki kubga o'xshaydi. Yuqoriga degani uchidan boshlashingiz va torni bosishingiz kerakligi va pastga degani strelkadan (qo'lingiz kamonni ushlab turgan nuqta) boshlashingiz va torni tortishingiz kerakligini anglatadi. Yuqori tor odatda yumshoqroq tovushni, pastki tor esa kuchliroq va shiddatliroq tovushni hosil qiladi. o'z belgilaringizni qalamda chizishdan tortinmang, biroq yodda tuting, bosma kamoncha belgilari musiqiy maqsadda yozilgan, shu sababli ular odatda e'tiborga olinishi kerak."
mt: The upper flag is similar to the letter V and the lower flag is similar to a square or cube with the bottom cut off. The upper flag indicates that you should start from the top and turn the flag clockwise, while the lower flag indicates that you should start from the flagstaff (the point where your hand is holding the flag) and turn the flag counterclockwise. The upper flag usually produces a softer sound, while the lower flag produces a louder and more forceful sound. Don't be afraid to write your own flags, but remember that flag flags are written for musical purposes, so they are usually meant to be read.
ref: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."

src: """Yuqori kamonsimon"" belgi V ga o'xshaydi va ""pastki kamonsimon belgi"" pastki tarafi tushirib qoldirilgan kvadratga yoki kubga o'xshaydi. src: Boshqa primatlardan farqli ravishda, gominidlar siljish yoki vaznini ko'tarish yoxud daraxtlar oralab o'tishda ortiq qo'llaridan foydalanmaydi. Shimpanzening qo'l va oyoq kaftlari o'lcham va uzunlik jihatidan bir xil, bu qo'lning bo'g'imda yurish paytida og'irlikni ko'tarish uchun foydalanilishida aks etadi. Inson qo'li tekisroq bo'g'imlarga ega bo'lib, oyoqdan kaltaroqdir. Yoshi ikki milliondan uch million yilgacha bo'lgan qo'l suyagi topilmalari qo'lning ixtisoslashuvi yurishdan qo'l mehnatiga ko'chganini ko'rsatadi.
mt: Unlike other primates, gorillas do not use their extra limbs for climbing or leaping. Chimpanzee hands and feet are of similar size and length, reflecting the use of the hand in carrying weight during walking. The human hand has flatter joints and is smaller than the foot. Fossil hand bones dating from two to three million years ago suggest that the hand was specialized for work from walking to hand labor.
ref: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.

src: Boshqa primatlardan farqli ravishda, gominidlar siljish yoki vaznini ko'tarish yoxud daraxtlar oralab o'tishda ortiq qo'llaridan foydalanmaydi. Shimpanzening qo'l va oyoq kaftlari o'lcham va uzunlik jihatidan bir xil, bu qo'lning bo'g'imda yurish paytida og'irlikni ko'tarish uchun foydalanilishida aks etadi. Inson qo'li tekisroq bo'g'imlarga ega bo'lib, oyoqdan kaltaroqdir. Yoshi ikki milliondan uch million yilgacha bo'lgan qo'l suyagi topilmalari qo'lning ixtisoslashuvi yurishdan qo'l mehnatiga ko'chganini ko'rsatadi.
mt: Unlike other primates, gorillas do not use their extra limbs for climbing or leaping. Chimpanzee hands and feet are of similar size and length, reflecting the use of the hand in carrying weight during walking. The human hand has flatter joints and is smaller than the foot. Fossil hand bones dating from two to three million years ago suggest that the hand was specialized for work from walking to hand labor.
ref: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.

src: Yigirmanchi asrdagi tadqiqotlar genetik o'zgarishning ikki havzasi: yashirin va ochiq ifodalangan havzalari mavjudligini ko'rsatdi. Mutatsiya yangi genetik variatsiyani qo'shadi va saralash tezlashgan variatsiyaning zaxirasidan uni olib tashlaydi. Segregatsiya va rekombinatsiya har bir avlod bilan ikkala pul o'rtasidagi variatsiyalarni aralashtiradi.
mt: 20th century research showed that there are two pools of genetic variation: a hidden pool and an open pool. A mutation adds a new genetic variant and segregation and recombination mix the variants between the two pools in each generation.
ref: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.

src: "Savannadan tashqarida, inson kabi ovqat hazm qilish tizimiga ega bo'lgan primat uchun aminokislotaga bo'lgan ehtiyojni mavjud o'simlik manbalaridan qondirish mushkul. Bundan tashqari bunday qila olmaslik quyidagi jiddiy oqibatlarga: depressiyaning ortishi, ozuqaviy moddalar yetishmasligi va nihoyat o'limga olib keladi. Yaproqlar hamda dukkakli ekinlarda bor bo'lgan oqsillar eng oson yetishtiriladigan o'simlik manbalari bo'lardi, lekin biz singari primatlar uchun pishirilmaguncha ularni hazm qilish mushkul. Bundan farqli o'laroq, mavjudot ozuqalar (chumolilar, termitlar, tuxumlar) nafaqat yengil hazm bo'ladi, balki ular muhim aminokislotalarning barchasini o'z ichiga olgan yuqori miqdordagi oqsillar bilan ham ta'minlaydi. Barcha narsalar hisobga olingan holda, agar ajdodlarimiz o'zlarining ""oqsil muammolarini"" bugungi kunda savanna shimpanzelariga o'xshash usulda hal qilgan bo'lsalar, ajablanmasligimiz kerak."
mt: "Outside the savanna, primates with a human-like digestive system have a hard time getting the amino acids they need from available plant sources. In addition, not being able to do so leads to the following serious consequences: depression, malnutrition, and eventually death. The proteins found in vines and fruiting plants would be the easiest to cultivate, but like us primates, they are difficult to digest until cooked. Unlike this, available foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easy to digest, but also provide high levels of the essential amino acids with all the proteins. Taking everything into account, if our ancestors solved their ""protein problems"" in the same way as today's savanna chimpanzees, it would not be surprising."
ref: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

src: Submadaniyatlar ijtimoiy standartlar tomonidan e'tiborsiz qoldirilganligini his qiluvchi va o'zlikni anglash hissini rivojlantirishga imkon beruvchi hamfikr shaxslarni birlashtiradi. Submadaniyatlar a'zolarning yoshi, etnik kelib chiqishi, sinfi, joylashuvi va/yoki jinsiga qarab ajralib turishi mumkin. Submadaniyatni yaqqol belgilab beradigan sifatlar lingvistik, estetik, diniy, siyosiy, jinsiy, geografik bo'lishi yoxud faktorlar kombinatsiyasi bo'lishi mumkin. Submadaniyat a'zolari ko'pincha o'z a'zoliklarini modalar, xulq-atvor va jargonlarni o'z ichiga olgan uslubdan o'ziga xos va ramziy foydalanish orqali namoyon etadilar.
mt: Subcultures are groups of people who share a common set of values that are ignored by mainstream society and who develop a sense of self through this. Subcultures may be distinguished by age, ethnicity, class, location, or gender. Subcultural identity is often expressed through the use of distinctive styles in dress, behavior, and slang.
ref: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members. The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.

src: "Irq va irqiy stereotiplar haqida tushuncha yosh bolalarda juda erta shakllanadi va mazkur irqiy stereotiplar xulq-atvorga ta'sir o'tkazadi. Masalan, o'zini ""maktabda yaxshi o'qimaydi"" stereotipi bilan qaraladigan irqiy ozchilikka mansub deb bilgan bolalar o'zlarining irqiga oid stereotip haqida eshitganidan so'ng maktabda yaxshi o'qimay qo'yishga moyil bo'lgan."
mt: "Concepts about race and racial stereotypes are formed very early in young children and these racial stereotypes influence behavior. For example, children who are perceived as belonging to a racial minority that is stereotyped as 'not doing well in school' are more likely to do poorly in school after hearing about the stereotype of their race."
ref: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.

src: "Beparvolik, baxtsiz hodisa yoki qasddan zo'ravonlik qilish orqali, voyaga yetayotganida kattalar tomonidan ijtimoiylashtirilmagan bolalar holatlaridan iborat kam sonli noxush holatlarini misol qilib keltirish ijtimoiylashuv muhimligini ko'rsatish uchun qo'llaniladigan keng tarqalgan usul hisoblanadi. Buday bolalar ""vahshiy"" yoki yovvoyi deb ataladi. Ba'zi vahshiy bolalar odamlar (odatda ularning ota-onalari) tomonidan cheklab qo'yilgan; ba'zi hollarda bolaning bunday tashlab ketilishiga ota-onalarning bolaning og'ir aqliy yoki jismoniy zaiflashuvidan yuz o'girishlari sabab bo'lgan. Vahshiy bolalar tashlab ketilishi yoki qochib ketishidan avval jiddiy zo'ravonlik yoki jarohatlarni boshdan kechirgan bo'lishlari mumkin. Boshqalarning hayvonlar tarafidan katta qilingani da'vo qilinadi; ba'zilarining yovvoyi tabiatda o'zlari yashaganligi aytiladi. To'liq inson bo'lmagan mavjudotlar tomonidan ulg'aytirilganda, yirtqich bola deyarli to'liqligicha aynan parvarish qilgan hayvonning xatti-harakatlariga o'xshash xulq-atvorni (jismoniy chegaralar doirasida), masalan, insonlardan qo'rqish yoki ularga befarqlikni namoyish etadi."
mt: "The term "wild child" is commonly used to illustrate the importance of socialization by referring to a small number of unfortunate cases of feral children, who are described as "ferocious" or "savage". Some feral children are abandoned by their parents; in other cases, their abandonment is a result of their parents' inability to cope with their children's severe mental or physical disabilities. Feral children may have suffered serious abuse or injuries before being abandoned or running away. They are said to have been raised by animals; some are said to have lived in a wild state. When raised by non-human animals, a feral child may exhibit behaviors similar to those of the animal that raised them (within physical constraints), such as fear of or indifference to humans."
ref: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. Such children are called ""feral"" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans."

src: Natural xo'jalik faqatgina dehqon va uning oilasi ehtiyojlarini qondirish uchun yetarli miqdorda mahsulot ishlab chiqarish uchun yuritiladigan xo'jalikdir. Yordamchi qishloq xo'jaligi — almashlab ekish bilan birga ekologik hududda saqlanib qolgan urug'lardan foydalanish yoki boshqa nisbatan oson texnikalar yordamida hosilni ko'paytiruvchi sodda, ko'p hollarda organik tizimdir. Tarixda ko'plab dehqonlar yordamchi qishloq xo'jaligi bilan mashg'ul bo'lishgan hamda ko'plab rivojlanayotgan davlatlarda hali ham shunday bo'lib qolmoqda.
mt: A subsistence farm is a farm that produces food only for the farmer and his family.  A supporting farm is a farm that uses ecological methods to preserve seeds from the previous harvest or other simple techniques to increase yield, such as crop rotation.  Many farmers have practiced supporting farming in the past and many developing countries still do.
ref: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.

src: Ehtimol, turizmning eng keng tarqalgan turi bu aksariyat odamlar sayohat bilan bog'laydigan rekreatsion turizmdir. Bu kishilarning odatiy kundalik hayot tarzidan ancha farqli bo'lgan yerga dam olish hamda ko'ngil ochish uchun borishidir. Plyajlar, mavzuli parklar va lager maydonlari ko'pincha hordiq chiqaruvchi sayyohlar tez-tez tashrif buyuradigan eng ommabop joylardir. Agar muayyan joyga tashrif buyurishdan maqsad uning tarixi hamda madaniyati bilan tanishish bo'lsa, unda turizmning mazkur turi madaniy turizm deb ataladi. Sayohatchilar muayyan davlatning turli diqqatga sazovor manzillariga tashrif buyurishlari yoxud shunchaki faqat bitta hududga e'tibor qaratishni afzal ko'rishlari mumkin.
mt: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is recreational tourism, which is when people travel to a place different from their usual daily life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and campgrounds are the most popular destinations for recreational tourists. If the purpose of a visit is to learn about the history and culture of a place, then this type of tourism is called cultural tourism. Tourists may prefer to visit various attractions in a country or just focus on one area.
ref: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.

src: Bunda qatnashgan kishilar bir necha o'n yillar davomida qiyinchiliklar va hattoki muvaffaqiyatsizliklarni ochiq baholagan holda kuchli tomonlarimiz va ehtiroslarimizni baholashimizga yordam berdilar. Shaxsiy, oilaviy hamda tashkiliy hikoyalari bilan o'rtoqlashuvchi kishilarni eshitish vaqtida bizda bebaho o'tmish va tashkilot madaniyatiga yaxshi yoki yomon ta'sir ko'rsatgan shaxslarning ayrimlari haqida tushuncha hosil bo'ldi. Biror kishining tarixini tushunish madaniyatni tushunishni anglatmaydi, lekin hech bo'lmaganda kishilarga tashkilot tarixi doirasida ularning qayerga tushib qolganini his qilishga yordam beradi. Muvaffaqiyatlarni baholash va xatolardan ogoh bo'lish davomida alohida shaxslar va butun qatnashuvchi shaxslar tashkilot qadriyatlari, missiyasi va harakatlantiruvchi kuchlarini yanada chuqurroq kashf qiladilar. Ushbu holatda, oldingi tadbirkorlik xatti-harakati holatlari hamda erishilgan yutuqlarni yodga olish insonlarga yangi o'zgarishlar va mahalliy cherkovlar uchun yangi yo'nalishlarga ochiq bo'lishiga yordam berdi. Muvaffaqiyat haqidagi bunday hikoyalar kelajakdagi o'zgarishga nisbatan ijobiy moyilliklarni yaratgan holda o'zgarishdan qo'rqish hissini kamaytirdi.
mt: People who participated in this event have openly acknowledged the difficulties and even failures of the past several years. Hearing the personal, family, and organizational stories of others, we gained a sense of the individuals and organizations who have had a positive or negative impact on the organizational culture. Understanding the history of an individual does not mean understanding the culture, but at least it helps us understand where they have come from. In acknowledging successes and failures, individuals and the entire organization gain a deeper understanding of the organization's values, mission, and driving forces. In this case, the stories of past entrepreneurial activities and achievements helped people to be more open to change and new directions for local churches. Stories of success have helped to create a positive attitude toward change and to reduce the fear of change.
ref: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.

src: Bunda qatnashgan kishilar bir necha o'n yillar davomida qiyinchiliklar va hattoki muvaffaqiyatsizliklarni ochiq baholagan holda kuchli tomonlarimiz va ehtiroslarimizni baholashimizga yordam berdilar. Shaxsiy, oilaviy hamda tashkiliy hikoyalari bilan o'rtoqlashuvchi kishilarni eshitish vaqtida bizda bebaho o'tmish va tashkilot madaniyatiga yaxshi yoki yomon ta'sir ko'rsatgan shaxslarning ayrimlari haqida tushuncha hosil bo'ldi. Biror kishining tarixini tushunish madaniyatni tushunishni anglatmaydi, lekin hech bo'lmaganda kishilarga tashkilot tarixi doirasida ularning qayerga tushib qolganini his qilishga yordam beradi. Muvaffaqiyatlarni baholash va xatolardan ogoh bo'lish davomida alohida shaxslar va butun qatnashuvchi shaxslar tashkilot qadriyatlari, missiyasi va harakatlantiruvchi kuchlarini yanada chuqurroq kashf qiladilar. Ushbu holatda, oldingi tadbirkorlik xatti-harakati holatlari hamda erishilgan yutuqlarni yodga olish insonlarga yangi o'zgarishlar va mahalliy cherkovlar uchun yangi yo'nalishlarga ochiq bo'lishiga yordam berdi. Muvaffaqiyat haqidagi bunday hikoyalar kelajakdagi o'zgarishga nisbatan ijobiy moyilliklarni yaratgan holda o'zgarishdan qo'rqish hissini kamaytirdi.
mt: People who participated in this event have openly acknowledged the difficulties and even failures of the past several years. Hearing the personal, family, and organizational stories of others, we gained a sense of the individuals and organizations who have had a positive or negative impact on the organizational culture. Understanding the history of an individual does not mean understanding the culture, but at least it helps us understand where they have come from. In acknowledging successes and failures, individuals and the entire organization gain a deeper understanding of the organization's values, mission, and driving forces. In this case, the stories of past entrepreneurial activities and achievements helped people to be more open to change and new directions for local churches. Stories of success have helped to create a positive attitude toward change and to reduce the fear of change.
ref: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.

src: Postmodern ta'lim yondashuvi mutloqliklardan ozodlikni taklif qiladi. o'rganish uchun yagona yaxshi usul mavjud emas. Aslida, o'rganish uchun bittagina yaxshi narsa mavjud emas. O'rganish taqdim etilgan bilim hamda o'rganuvchi orasidagi tajribada sodir bo'ladi. Barcha o'z qo'lingiz bilan bajariladigan ishlar va axborot taqdim etish bilan bog'liq amaldagi tajribamiz, o'rganishga asoslangan teleko'rsatuvlar shuni ko'rsatib turibdi. Shu tarzda, bizlarning ko'pchiligimiz o'zimiz hech qachon qatnashmaydigan yoki o'sha bilimlarni qo'llamaydigan jarayon yoki tajriba to'g'risida ma'lumot beruvchi teleko'rsatuvlarni tomosha qilyapmiz. Biz hech qachon avtomobilni kapital ta'mirlamaymiz, qadimgi xarobalarni o'rganish uchun Peruga sayohat qilmaymiz yoki qo'shnimizning uyini qayta modellashtirmaymiz.
mt: Postmodern education philosophy offers freedom from authority. There is no single good way to learn. Indeed, there is no single good thing to learn. Learning happens between the given knowledge and the learner's experience. All our active experience and knowledge of the active use of information is based on learning. Thus, we are all watching programs that are not participating in or using the knowledge they are presenting. We never fix our cars, study ruins in Perugia, or remodel our neighbor's house.
ref: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn. In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point. So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge. We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.

src: Uyqu uzilishi — bu sizning odatdagi uyqu vaqtingizdan atay uyg'onish va qisqa vaqtdan keyin (10–60 daqiqa) uyquga ketish jarayonidir. Sizni to'liq uyg'otmasdan xushingizga keltirish uchun birmuncha sokin bo'lgan budilnikdan foydalanib, buni osongina bajarish mumkin. Agar siz uyqudaligingizda soatni o'chirib qo'yayotgan bo'lsangiz, uni xonaning boshqa burchagiga qo'yishingiz mumkin, bu holda uni o'chirish uchun o'rningizdan turishingizga to'g'ri keladi. Bioritmga asoslanuvchi boshqa variantlar uyqudan avval ko'p miqdorda suyuqlik (xususan, suv yoki choy, siydik haydovchi sifatida ma'lum) ichishdan iborat, bu bovul qilish uchun turishga majburlaydi.
mt: Napping — this is a period of wakefulness that occurs during usual sleep time, and is followed by a short period of sleep (10–60 minutes). It can be easily achieved by using a soft alarm clock, without waking you completely. If you are setting the alarm to wake you up during sleep, you can place it on the other side of the room, so that you have to get up to turn it off. Other variants based on biorhythms involve drinking a lot of liquid (such as water or tea, as a diuretic) before napping, which forces you to urinate.
ref: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you. If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.

src: Ayrim kishilar tez-tez sun'iy ravishda qo'zg'atilgan ongli tushlarni ko'rish juda ham toliqtirishi mumkin deb hisoblaydi. Bu hodisaning asosiy sababi REM fazasi o'rtasidagi vaqt uzunligini kengaytiruvchi ongli tushlarning natijasidir. Har tuniga kamroq sondagi REM lar bilan siz haqiqiy uyquni boshingizdan kechiradigan va tanangiz qayta tiklanadigan bu holat muammoga aylanish uchun yetarli darajada kamroq bo'lib boradi. Bu go'yoki har yigirma yoki o'ttiz daqiqada uyg'onib, televizor ko'rish kabi toliqtiradi. Natija sizning miyangizning bir kechada qanchalik aniq tush ko'rishga urinishiga bog'liq.
mt: Some people believe that it is possible to see lucid dreams artificially induced. The main cause of this phenomenon is the lengthening of REM phase by lucid dreams. With fewer REMs per day, you are entering a state of sleep that is not being restored by your brain. This may be as little as twenty or thirty minutes of waking up and watching TV. The result is that your brain is trying to lucidly dream as quickly as it can.
ref: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.

src: "Virtual jamoalar odatiy jamoalarniki bilan bir xil mukammallik standartlariga amal qiladi, lekin sezilmas farqlar bor. Virtual guruh a'zolari tez-tez o'zlarining jismoniy guruhlari uchun aloqa punkti vazifasini bajaradi. Ularning jamoalari mahalliy boshqaruv tizimi tushunmasligi mumkin bo'lgan turli vaqt zonalariga ko'ra uchrashishi mumkinligi sababli ularda ko'pincha an'anaviy jamoalarga qaraganda ko'proq avtonomiya bo'ladi. Haqiqiy ""ko'rinmas jamoa""ning borligi (Larson hamda LaFasto, 1989, 109-bet) virtual jamoaning o'ziga xos komponenti hamdir. ""Ko'rinmas jamoa"" — bu a'zolarning har biri hisobot beruvchi boshqaruv jamoasidir. Ko'rinmas jamoa har bir a'zo uchun standartlarni belgilab beradi."
mt: "Virtual teams are similar to traditional teams in that they are expected to meet the same standards of excellence, but they have some distinct differences. Virtual team members often serve as the communication hub for their physical teams, making them more autonomous than traditional teams because of the time zone differences that may make it difficult for the traditional team to communicate with the virtual team. The ""invisible team"" (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p. 109) is a unique component of the virtual team. The ""invisible team"" is a team of individuals who are each reporting to a virtual management team. The invisible team sets the standards for each member."
ref: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group. They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management. The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.

src: "Kontent nazariyalari diqqatni odamlarga ta'sir qiladigan yoki ularni jalb qiladigan narsalarni topishga qaratilgan. Mazkur nazariyalar shuni ko'rsatadiki, insonlar balog'at yoshiga qadam qo'yguniga qadar, ularda muayyan ichki ehtiyojlar va/yoki xohishlar bo'ladi. Ushbu nazariyalar ma'lum odamlar qilishni istagan ishlarini qilishlariga nima undashini va muhitlaridagi qanday omilar ma'lum narsalarni qilishlaru yoki qilmasliklariga ta'sir qilishini ko'rib chiqadi. Mohiyat bo'yicha qiziqtirishning ikki mashhur nazariyalari — Maslouning ""Ehtiyojlar piramidasi"" nazariyasi va Gersbergning ""Ikki omil"" nazariyasi."
mt: "Content theories are concerned with what attracts or draws attention to people. These theories assume that until the age of reason, people have certain internal needs and/or desires. These theories examine what motivates people to do what they want to do and what environmental factors influence whether or not they do what they want to do. Two popular theories of interest are Maslow's "Hierarchy of Needs" theory and Herzberg's "Two Factor" theory."
ref: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them. These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood. These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.

src: Ko'p haqorat qilingan va ko'pincha istehzo qilingan uchdan bir qoidasi suratdagi tartib o'lchovini saqlagan holda jo'shqinlikni yaratadigan oddiy yo'riqnomadir. Unda asosiy subyekt uchun eng samarali joy suratni vertikal va gorizontal tarzda uchga bo'ladigan chiziqlar kesishmasida ekanligi aytilgan (namunaga qarang).
mt: A simple guide to creating a pleasing composition in a photograph is to place the main subject in the area where the vertical and horizontal lines of the frame intersect (see example).
ref: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image. It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).

src: Masalan, dunyodagi eng keng suratga olish formati 35 mm bo'lib, bu analog fotoplyonkalar davri yakunida ustun bo'lgan fotoplyonka o'lchami bo'lgan. U bugungi kunda ham ishlab chiqariladi, biroq eng muhimi, uning tomonlar nisbati raqamli kamera tasvir sensori formatlari tomonidan meros qilib olingan. 35 mm format aslida bir oz chalkash bo'lib, kengligi 36 mm va balandligi 24 mm. Shunga ko'ra, mazkur formatning tomonlar nisbati (eng oddiy butun son nisbatini olish uchun o'n ikkiga bo'lish) 3:2 bo'lishi kerak deyiladi. Ko'plab umumiy formatlar (masalan, APS formatlar oilasi) mazkur tomonlar nisbatiga teng yoki ancha yaqin.
mt: 35 mm is the most common film format, and was the standard for analog film cameras during the era of film. It is still produced, but the most important thing is that its aspect ratio is inherited by digital camera image sensor formats. The 35 mm format is actually a little confusing, with a width of 36 mm and a height of 24 mm. So the aspect ratio of this format should be 3:2, which is the most common whole number ratio. Many common formats (such as the APS family of formats) are close to or equal to this aspect ratio.
ref: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era. It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats. The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height. The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2. Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.

src: Yaqinlashtiruvchi linzalarning asosiy noqulayligi shundan iboratki, fokusning murakkabligi va fokus masofasiga erishish uchun talab qilingan linza elementlari soni asosiy fokusli linzalarga qaraganda ancha katta bo'ladi. Obyektiv ishlab chiqaruvchilarning obyektiv ishlab chiqarishda erishgan yuqori standartlari tufayli bu tobora arzimas muammoga aylanib bormoqda. Bu yaqinlashtirish linzalari o'zgarmas fokusli linzalar yordamida erishilgan natija bilan taqqoslanadigan rasmlar yaratish imkonini beradi. Yaqinlashtiruvchi obyektivlarning boshqa bir kamchiligi shundaki, obyektivning maksimal diafragmasi (tezligi) odatda pastroq bo'ladi. Bu yorug'lik kam bo'lgan sharoitlarda arzon kattalashtiruvchi linzalardan chaqnoqsiz foydalanishni qiyinlashtiradi.
mt: The main drawback of telecentric lenses is that the complexity of the focus and the number of lens elements required to achieve the focus distance are much higher than for standard focus lenses. The high standards achieved by lens manufacturers in the production of lenses have made this increasingly insignificant problem. This telecentric lens allows the creation of images comparable to those achieved with fixed-focus lenses. Another drawback of telecentric lenses is that the maximum aperture (speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes it difficult to use inexpensive telecentric lenses without a tripod in low-light conditions.
ref: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses. This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production. This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.

src: Tasavvuf — bu yakuniy voqelik, ilohiylik, ma'naviy ishonch yoki Xudodan ongli ravishda xabardor bo'lish, o'zlikni anglash, Xudo bilan muloqotda bo'lish istagining mavjudligidir. E'tiqod qiluvchi ilohiy borliq/ma'bud yoki ma'budlarga bo'lgan bevosita tajriba, ichki his yoki tushunchani izlaydi. Shogirdlar hayotning muayyan yo'llarini yoxud ushbu tajribani boyitishga qaratilgan amaliyotlarni davom ettiradilar. Tasavvuf noyob ong holatini, xususan, tinch, ziyrak, saodatli va hatto ekstatik xarakterga ega holatni bevosita boshdan kechirishga urg'u berishi orqali boshqa diniy e'tiqod va ibodat shakllaridan farqlanishi mumkin.
mt: Mysticism is the ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual faith or awareness of the presence of a deity or deities, or a transcendent being or beings. Believers seek direct experience or knowledge of a reality, or truth, that is beyond the senses or immediate physical perception, and sometimes apply restrictive concepts in order to describe the effects and process of this attainment, such as being "in the presence of God". Disciples of mysticism continue along certain paths or practices to further develop this experience. Mysticism may be contrasted with religious experience in that the latter emphasizes a "personal relationship with God" or a "personal relationship with the divine" as opposed to a "direct experience of God".
ref: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God. The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties. Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences. Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.

src: Tasavvuf — bu yakuniy voqelik, ilohiylik, ma'naviy ishonch yoki Xudodan ongli ravishda xabardor bo'lish, o'zlikni anglash, Xudo bilan muloqotda bo'lish istagining mavjudligidir. E'tiqod qiluvchi ilohiy borliq/ma'bud yoki ma'budlarga bo'lgan bevosita tajriba, ichki his yoki tushunchani izlaydi. Shogirdlar hayotning muayyan yo'llarini yoxud ushbu tajribani boyitishga qaratilgan amaliyotlarni davom ettiradilar. Tasavvuf noyob ong holatini, xususan, tinch, ziyrak, saodatli va hatto ekstatik xarakterga ega holatni bevosita boshdan kechirishga urg'u berishi orqali boshqa diniy e'tiqod va ibodat shakllaridan farqlanishi mumkin.

Believers seek direct experience or knowledge of a reality, or truth, that is beyond the senses or immediate physical perception, and sometimes apply restrictive concepts in order to describe the effects and process of this attainment, such as being "in the presence of God". Disciples of mysticism continue along certain paths or practices to further develop this experience. Mysticism may be contrasted with religious experience in that the latter emphasizes a "personal relationship with God" or a "personal relationship with the divine" as opposed to a "direct experience of God".

src: 19 va 20-asrlarda moalar deb ataluvchi ulkan qushlarni ovlovchi Maori xalqi Yangi Zelandiyaning ilk aholisi ekanligiga uzoq vaqt ishonib kelingan. Keyinchalik Maori odamlari Buyuk flotda Polineziyadan ko'chib kelib, Morioridan Yangi Zelandiyani tortib olgani, shu orqali qishloq xo'jaligiga asoslangan jamiyat yaratgani bilan bog'liq g'oyaga asoslangan nazariya paydo bo'ldi. Ammo yangi dalillar Moriorilarning Yangi Zelandiyadan Chatham orollariga ko'chib kelib, o'zlarining boshqalardan farqli, osoyishta madaniyatini yaratgan asosiy maorilar jamosi bo'lganligini ko'rsatadi. Chatem orollarida boshqa bir qabila – Yangi Zelandiyadan ko'chib ketgan Maori qabilasi ham bor edi. Ular o'zlarini Moriorilar deb atagan, bir nechta to'qnashuvlar bo'lgan va oxir-oqibat, Moriorilar yo'q qilingan.
mt: 19th and 20th century Maori people were believed to be the first inhabitants of New Zealand. Later, Maori people came from Polynesia in the Great Fleet, and took over the Chatham Islands, creating a society based on agriculture. A new theory suggests that the Moriori were the original Maori people, who created their own distinct culture after moving to the Chatham Islands from New Zealand. Another tribe, the Maori, also came from New Zealand. They called themselves Moriori, had several skirmishes, and eventually the Moriori were wiped out.
ref: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas. The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture. There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand. They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out

src: Pyurlend origami — bu bir vaqtning o'zida faqat bitta buklama bajarilishi mumkin bo'lgan, teskari buklamalar kabi murakkab buklamalarga yo'l qo'yilmaydigan va barcha buklamalar oddiy o'ringa ega bo'lgan origamidir. U tajribasiz buklovchilarga yoxud harakatlanish ko'nikmalari cheklanganlarga ko'mak berish maqsadida 1970-yillarda Jon Smit tomonidan ishlab chiqilgan.
mt: Pyurlend origami is origami that can only be folded into one crease at a time, without any creases being crossed, and where all creases are of equal length. It was invented by John Smith in the 1970s to help novice folders or those with limited mobility.
ref: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations. It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.

src: Hind vodiysi sivilizatsiyasi — hozirgi Pokistonning aksariyat qismi hamda shimoli-sharqiy Afg'oniston va shimoli-g'arbiy Hindistondagi ba'zi viloyatlarni o'z ichiga olgan shimoli-g'arbiy Hindiston subkontinentida joylashgan Bronza davri svilizatsiyasi edi. Bu tamaddun Hind daryosi havzasida gullab-yashnadi, shu sababli uning nomini oldi. Ba'zi olimlar hozirda qurib bitgan Sarasvati daryosi havzalarida ham sivilizatsiya mavjud bo'lganligi sababli, u mos ravishda Hind-Sarasvati sivilizatsiyasi deb nomlanishi kerak, deb ta'kidlasa-da, ayrimlar 1920-yillarda qazilgan joylardan birinchisi — Harappa sharafiga uni Harappa sivilizatsiyasi deb ataydi.
mt: The Indus Valley civilization was a Bronze Age civilization in the northwestern Indian subcontinent, mainly in the modern territories of Pakistan and India. It is also known as the Harappan civilization, after its first excavated site, Harappa. The Indus Valley civilization was one of the largest early urban civilizations, and one of the world's first state-level societies. It is considered one of five great ancient civilizations, along with Mesopotamia, Ancient Egypt, Ancient China, and Norte Chico. The Harappan civilization was a highly developed civilization, with a writing system, urban centers, and advanced infrastructure. ref: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan. The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name. Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.

src: Ochko'zlik va xudbinlik doimo biz bilan birga bo'ladi va hamkorlikning tabiati shuki, ko'pchilik foyda ko'radigan holatda xudbinlarcha harakat qilish qisqa muddatli istiqbolda har doim ko'proq foyda keltiradi. Aksariyat kishilar ularning uzoq muddatli eng yaxshi tanlovi – bu boshqalar bilan birgalikda ishlash ekanligini anglab yetadi, deb umid qilamiz.
mt: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and the nature of cooperation is that when most people benefit from it, selfishness will always be more profitable in the short term. Most people realize that their best long-term choice is to work together, we hope.
ref: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefit there will always be more to gain in the short term by acting selfishly Hopefully, most people will realise that their long term best option is to work together with others.

src: AQSH imperalizmining Filippinni bosib olishdagi urush harajatlari Filippinliklarning o'zlari tomonidan to'langan. Chiqimlarning asosiy qismini hamda Uoll-strit bank uylari orqali Filippin hukumati nomiga joylashtirilgan obligatsiyalar foizlarini qoplash uchun ular AQSH mustamlakachilik rejimiga soliq to'lovlarini to'lashga majbur qilindi. Shubhasiz, Filippin xalqining davomli ekspluatatsiyasidan olingan ulkan foydalar AQSH imperializmining asosiy daromadlarini tashkil qiladi.
mt: The costs of the American imperialist war of conquest of the Philippines were paid by the Filipinos themselves. The main part of the outlays and the interest on the bonds placed in the Wall Street banks under the name of the Philippine government forced them to pay the taxes of the American colonial regime. Without doubt, the enormous profits from the continuous exploitation of the Filipino people constitute the main source of income of the American imperialist regime.
ref: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves. They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses. Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.

src: Tampliyerlarni tushunish uchun ordenni yaratishga turtki bo'lgan muhitni tushunish zarur. Voqealar sodir bo'lgan vaqt umumiy holda Yuqori o'rta asrlar deb ataluvchi Yevropa tarixidagi 11, 12 va 13-asrlardir (m. 1000–1300 yillar). Yuqori o'rta asrlardan keyin Erta o'rta asrlar va undan keyin shartli ravishda 1500-yillar atrofida tugaydigan Kech o'rta asrlar keladi.
mt: To understand the Templars, one must understand the environment in which they were created. The events took place in the general period of the High Middle Ages, which is the 11th, 12th and 13th centuries (c. 1000–1300). After the High Middle Ages, the Early Middle Ages and then the conditional 1500s come, which is the Late Middle Ages.
ref: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order. The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300). The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.

src: Rim imperiyasining militaristik tabiati tibbiyot yutuqlarining taraqqiyotiga ko'maklashdi. Imperator Avgust shifokorlarni yollay boshladi hamda ular hattoki urushlardan so'ng foydalanish maqsadida birinchi Rim tibbiyot korpusini yaratishdi. Jarrohlar ko'knor urug'i ekstraktlaridan olingan morfin va mingdevona urug'idan olingan skopolaminni o'z ichiga olgan turli tinchlantiruvchi vositalar to'g'risida ma'lumotga ega edilar. Ular kasallarni gangrenadan saqlash uchun amputatsiya qilish, shuningdek, qon oqishini to'xtatish uchun turniket va arterial qisqichlardan foydalanishda mohir bo'lib olishdi. Bir necha asrlar davomida Rim imperiyasi tibbiyot sohasida ulkan g'alabalarga erishgan va hozirgi vaqtda bizga ma'lum bilimlarning katta qismini shakllantirdi.
mt: The militaristic nature of the Roman Empire helped advance medical achievements. Emperor Augustus began hiring physicians and even created the first Roman medical corps for use after wars. Surgeons were aware of various tranquilizers including morphine from poppy extract and scopolamine from henbane. They were adept at saving patients from gangrene by amputation, as well as stopping bleeding with tourniquets and arterial clamps. For several centuries the Roman Empire achieved great advances in medicine and today we have much of our current knowledge to thank them for.
ref: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances. Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds. They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow. Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.

src: "Sikxizm Hind submaterigidagi dindir. U Panjob mintaqasida 15-asrda Hinduizm an'analari doirasidagi sektalarga bo'linish natijasida kelib chiqqan. Sikxlar garchi o'z e'tiqodlarining Hinduizm asosidagi ildizlar va an'analarga egaligini tan olsalar ham, uni hinduizmdan alohida din deb hisoblaydilar. Sikxlar o'z dinini ""Gurmat"" deb ataydi, bu panjob tilida ""guru yo'li"" degani. Guru barcha hind dinlarining asosiy xususiyatidir, biroq sikxizmda sikx e'tiqodi asosini tashkil etuvchi ahamiyatga ega. Mazkur dinga Guru Nanak (1469–1539) tomonidan 15-asrda asos solingan. So'ngra to'qqiz nafar guru ketma-ket ergashdi."
mt: "Sikhism is a religion of the Indian subcontinent. It emerged in the 15th century as a sect of Hinduism, but the Sikhs consider it a separate religion. Although Sikhs recognize the Hindu roots of their beliefs and practices, they consider Sikhism to be distinct from Hinduism. Sikhs call their religion "Gurmat", meaning "the way of the guru". The guru is a central concept in all Hindu religions, but in Sikhism it is of particular importance. This religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). Then nine gurus followed one after another."
ref: "Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for ""way of the guru"". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus."

src: "Diqqatni jamlay olmaslik buzilishi ""bu nevrologik sindrom bo'lib, uning klassik aniqlovchi alomatlari impulsivlik, chalg'ituvchanlik va giperfaollik yoki ortiqcha energiyani o'z ichiga oladi"". Bu o'rganishga layoqatsizlik emas, bu o'rganish faoliyatidagi buzilish; bu ""barcha bolalarning 3–5 foizi, ehtimol, qariyb 2 million amerikalik bolalarga ta'sir o'tkazadi"". ADDga yo'liqqan bolalar o'qish mashg'ulotlari kabi narsalarga diqqat jamlashga qiynaladi, lekin ular o'yinlar o'ynash yoki sevimli multfilmlarini tomosha qilish yoxud gaplarni tinish belgilarisiz yozish kabi narsalarga diqqatini jamlay oladi. Ushbu bolalar odatda ko'p muammolarga duch keladi, chunki ular o'zlarining ongini odatiy usullar bilan rag'batlantira olmaganliklari uchun rag'batlantirish maqsadida ""qaltis xatti-harakatlarda ishtirok etishadi, janjallarga kirishishadi va hokimiyatga qarshi chiqishadi"". ADD boshqa tengdoshlar bilan munosabatlarga ta'sir qiladi, chunki boshqa bolalar ularning o'zlarini nega bunday tutishini yoki nega bunday talaffuz qilishini yoxud ularning yetuklik darajasi boshqacha ekanini tushuna olmaydilar."
mt: "Inattention is a neurobehavioral syndrome that includes impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excessive energy." This is not a lack of intelligence, it is a deficit in attention; this affects "about 3–5 percent of all children, perhaps 2 million American children." ADD children have difficulty paying attention to reading lessons, but they can pay attention to playing games or watching favorite cartoons or writing without punctuation. These children often get into trouble, because they are unable to motivate their minds in ordinary ways, they "engage in inappropriate behaviors, get into fights, and act out against authority." ADD affects relationships with other peers, because other children are unable to understand why they act or speak the way they do or why their maturity level is different.
ref: "Attention Deficit Disorder ""is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy"". It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it ""affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children"". Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation. These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they ""engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority"" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods. ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different."

src: Loyihaga asoslangan ta'lim o'rganishni osonroq va qiziqarli qilsa, ko'mak chegaralardan ham oshadi. Havoza ta'lim berish usuli emas, balki yangi kompyuter dasturidan foydalanish yoki yangi loyihani boshlash singari yangi tajribani boshidan o'tkazayotgan kishilarga ko'rsatiladigan yordamdir. Havozalar ham virtual, ham haqiqiy bo'lishi mumkin, boshqacha qilib aytadigan bo'lsak, o'qituvchi havoza shaklidir, biroq Microsoft Office'dagi kichkina odamsifat qog'oz qisqich ham shunday. Virtual ko'mak dasturiy ta'minot ichiga o'rnatilgan va ular talaba o'zi hal qilishi qiyin bo'lgan jarayonlar haqida savol berish, yordam berish, tushuntirish uchun mo'ljallangan.
mt: While project-based learning makes education easier and more interesting, help also goes beyond the limits. Help is not a teaching method, but a help to people who are trying a new experience for the first time. Helpers can be virtual or real, in other words, the teacher is a helper, but a little paper clip in Microsoft Office is also like that. Virtual help is embedded in software and is designed to ask questions, help, and explain processes that are difficult for the student to solve.
ref: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond. Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project. Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office. Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.

src: MySpace Qo'shma Shtatlarda foydalaniladigan uchinchi eng mashhur sayt hisoblanadi va ayni vaqtda 54 millionta profilga ega. Bu veb-saytlar, xususan, ta'lim muassasalarida yuqori e'tibor qozondi. Mazkur veb-saytlar ijobiy jihatlarga ega, jumladan, bloglar, videolar, rasmlar va boshqa xususiyatlarni o'z ichiga olgan sinf sahifasini osongina o'rnata oladi. Mazkur sahifaga birgina veb-manzilni ko'rsatish orqali osongina kirish mumkin, bu klaviaturadan foydalanish yoki imloda muammolari bor talabalar uchun yozish va eslab qolishni osonlashtiradi. Uni o'qishni osonlashtirish, shuningdek kerakli darajada ko'proq yoki kamroq rangli qilib sozlash mumkin.
mt: MySpace is the third most popular website in the United States, with 54 million profiles. These websites, especially in schools, have received a lot of attention. These websites have positive features, such as blogs, videos, pictures, and other features that make it easy to create a class page. This page can be easily accessed by simply entering the website address, which makes it easy for students who have problems with typing or spelling. It also makes reading easier, as well as making it possible to make it more or less colorful.
ref: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently. These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting. There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features. This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling. It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.

src: Biroq 1956-yilning iyunida xodimlar oziq-ovqat tanqisligi hamda ish haqi kamaytirilishiga qarshi namoyishlar o'tkazayotgan joyda, kommunizmga qarshi umumiy norozilikka aylanib ketganda, Polshadagi tartibsizliklar vaqtida Xrushchevning va'dalari sinovdan o'tkazildi. Oxir-oqibat, Xrushchyov tartibni qayta tiklash maqsadida tanklarni yuborganligiga qaramay, u ayrim iqtisodiy talablarga yon berdi hamda mashhur Vladislav Gomulkani yangi bosh vazir etib tayinlashga rozilik berdi.
mt: However, in June 1956, workers protesting food shortages and wage cuts turned the general strike against communism into a general protest against Khrushchev's promises.  Despite sending in tanks to restore order, Khrushchev eventually conceded to some economic demands and appointed the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as prime minister.
ref: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism. Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.

src: Germaniya Ikkinchi jahon urushida SSSR bilan AQSH o'rtasidagi hamkorlikka sababchi bo'lgan umumiy dushman edi. Urush tugashi bilan tizim, taraqqiyot jarayoni hamda madaniyat to'qnashuvlari davlatlarni o'zaro nizoga boshladi. Urush tugaganidan ikki yil o'tgach, sobiq ittifoqdoshlar endilikda dushmanga aylangandi hamda Sovuq urush boshlandi. U keyingi 40 yil davom etishi va Afrikadan tortib Osiyogacha, Afg'oniston, Kuba va boshqa ko'pgina jang maydonlarida proxi armiyalar tomonidan haqiqiy jang olib borilishi kerak edi.
mt: Germany was a common enemy of the Soviet Union and the United States during World War II. After the war, the system, the development process and the cultural clashes began to lead the states to conflict. Two years after the war, former allies have become enemies and the Cold War began. It lasted for the next 40 years and was fought by proxy armies in Africa, Asia, Afghanistan, Cuba and other battlefields.
ref: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out. With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began. It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.

src: Asab tizimi uzluksiz qon oqimini ta'minlash uchun tana bo'ylab asab impulslarini yuborish orqali gomeostazni ta'minlaydi. Mazkur asab impulslari tana bo'ylab nihoyatda tez yuboriladi, bu esa vujudni har qanday ehtimoliy xvafdan saqlashga yordam beradi.
mt: The nervous system maintains homeostasis by sending electrical impulses throughout the body to maintain constant blood flow. These electrical impulses are sent very quickly throughout the body, which helps to protect the body from any possible harm.
ref: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through out the body to keep the flow of blood going as well as undisturbed. These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body which helps keep the body safe from any potential threat.

src: "Giza shahridagi Buyuk piramida bugun ham mavjud bo'lgan yetti mo'jizaning biridir. Eramizdan avvalgi uchinchi asrda misrliklar tomonidan bunyod etilgan Buyuk Piramida vafot etgan Fir'avn sharafiga barpo qilingan ko'plab yirik piramida inshootlaridan biri hisoblanadi. Misr o'liklar vodiysidagi Giza platosi yoki ""Giza qabristoni"" bir qancha piramidalar (ularning eng yirigi — buyuk piramida), bir nechta kichik qabrlar, bir qancha ibodatxonalar va buyuk Sfinksni o'z ichiga oladi. Buyuk piramida fir'avn Xufu sharafiga bunyod etilgan hamda ko'plab kichik piramidalar, maqbaralar va ma'badlar Xufuning xotinlari hamda oila a'zolarining sharafiga bunyod etilgan."
mt: "The Great Pyramid of Giza is one of the seven wonders of the world. It was built by the Egyptians in the third century BC in honor of the Pharaoh Khufu. The Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramids built in the Giza plateau or "Giza necropolis" which includes many pyramids (the largest being the Great Pyramid), several small tombs, several temples and the Great Sphinx. The Great Pyramid was built in honor of Pharaoh Khufu and many small pyramids, tombs and temples were built in honor of his wives and family members."
ref: "The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today. Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh. The Giza Plateau, or ""Giza Necropolis"" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx. The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members."

src: Efesdagi Artemida ibodatxonasi m.a. 356-yil 21-iyulda Gerostratning qasddan o't qo'yishi oqibatida vayron qilingan. Hikoyaga ko'ra, uning muddaosi istalgancha badal evaziga mashhur bo'lish edi. G'azablangan efesliklar Gerostratning nomi hech qachon qayd etilmasligini e'lon qiladi. Keyinchalik yunon tarixchisi Strabon mazkur nomni qayd etgan, shu tarzda biz bugun undan xabardormiz. Ibodatxona Buyuk Aleksandr dunyoga kelgan tunda vayron etilgan. Aleksandr shoh sifatida ibodatxonani qayta qurish uchun pul to'lashni taklif qildi, biroq uning taklifi rad etildi. Keyinchalik, Aleksandr vafotidan so'ng, m.a.323-yilda ibodatxona qayta barpo qilindi.
mt: 21 July 356 BC, the Temple of Artemis in Ephesus was destroyed by Herostratus in a deliberate arson. According to the story, its duration was to be famous for any ransom. The angry Ephesians decreed that the name of Herostratus would never be recorded. Later Greek historian Strabo recorded the name, thus we are aware of it today. The temple was destroyed at nightfall. Alexander the Great offered to pay for its reconstruction, but his offer was rejected. Later, after Alexander's death, in 323 BC, the temple was rebuilt.
ref: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus. According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded. The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.

src: Efesdagi Artemida ibodatxonasi m.a. 356-yil 21-iyulda Gerostratning qasddan o't qo'yishi oqibatida vayron qilingan. Hikoyaga ko'ra, uning muddaosi istalgancha badal evaziga mashhur bo'lish edi. G'azablangan efesliklar Gerostratning nomi hech qachon qayd etilmasligini e'lon qiladi. Keyinchalik yunon tarixchisi Strabon mazkur nomni qayd etgan, shu tarzda biz bugun undan xabardormiz. Ibodatxona Buyuk Aleksandr dunyoga kelgan tunda vayron etilgan. Aleksandr shoh sifatida ibodatxonani qayta qurish uchun pul to'lashni taklif qildi, biroq uning taklifi rad etildi. Keyinchalik, Aleksandr vafotidan so'ng, m.a.323-yilda ibodatxona qayta barpo qilindi.
mt: 21 July 356 BC, the Temple of Artemis in Ephesus was destroyed by Herostratus in a deliberate arson. According to the story, its duration was to be famous for any ransom. The angry Ephesians decreed that the name of Herostratus would never be recorded. Later Greek historian Strabo recorded the name, thus we are aware of it today. The temple was destroyed at nightfall. Alexander the Great offered to pay for its reconstruction, but his offer was rejected. Later, after Alexander's death, in 323 BC, the temple was rebuilt.
ref: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus. According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded. The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.

src: Dastlabki ma'lum transport — bu yurish edi, insonlar ikki million yillar ilgari Homo Erectus (tik odam ma'nosini bildiradi) paydo bo'lishi bilan tik yura boshlagan. Ularning ajdodlari bo'lgan avstralopiteklar odatda tik harakatlanishmagan. Garchi yetti million yil avval Sahelantrop ikki oyoq bilan yurgan bo'lishi ehtimoli bo'lsa ham, ikki oyoqli harakatga ixtisoslashish 4,2–3,9 million yillar oldingi Avstralopitek qoldiqlarida topilgan.
mt: The first known transport was walking, which humans began doing when they started walking upright around 2 million years ago. Their ancestors, the australopithecines, were not bipedal. Although Sahelanthropus, which lived around 7 million years ago, may have been bipedal, bipedalism became specialized around 4.2–3.9 million years ago in Australopithecus fossils.
ref: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man). Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually. Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.

src: Mahsulotlarni tashish uchun kemalardan foydalanish yirik miqdordagi insonlar va mahsulotlarni okeanlar bo'ylab harakatlantirishning eng samarali usulidir. Dengiz kuchlarining vazifasi, an'anaga ko'ra, davlatingizning kishilar va mahsulotlarni ko'chirish qobiliyatini saqlash, shu bilan bir vaqtda raqibingizning o'z odamlari va mahsulotlarini ko'chirish qobiliyatiga to'sqinlik qilishdir. Buning eng e'tiborga molik bo'lgan so'nggi misollaridan biri Ikkinchi jahon urushining Shimoliy Atlantika harbiy harakatlari bo'ldi. Amerikaliklar Britaniyaga yordam berish uchun insonlar va materiallarni Atlantika okeani orqali ko'chirishga harakat qilayotgandi. Shu bilan birga Nemis dengiz floti, asosan, dengizosti qayiqlaridan foydalanib, ushbu transport harakatini to'xtatishga urinayotgandi. Agar ittifoqchilar g'alabaga qozonmaganida Germaniya, Yevropaning boshqa qismlaridek Britaniyani ham bosib olishi mumkin edi.
mt: The most notable example of this was the Second World War's North Atlantic military operations. The Americans were trying to help Britain by moving people and material across the Atlantic Ocean. At the same time, the German navy, using mostly submarines, was trying to stop this transport movement. If the allies had not won, Germany could have taken over Britain, just as it had taken over the rest of Europe.
ref: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans. The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods. One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic. Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.

src: Kegayli g'ildiraklarning ixtiro qilinishi Ossuriya aravalarini yengilroq, tezroq va askarlar hamda boshqa aravalardan o'zib ketishga yaxshiroq darajada tayyor bo'lishiga olib keldi. Ularning dahshatli arbaletlaridan otilgan o'qlar dushman askarlari zirhlariga kirishi mumkin edi. Miloddan avvalgi 1000-yil atrofida Ossuriyaliklar birinchi otliq qo'shinni yaratdilar. Otliqlar otda jang qiladigan qo'shindir. Egarlar hali kashf qilinmaganligi sababli, Ossuriya otliqlari o'z otlariga egarsiz mingan holda jang qilgan.
mt: The invention of the chariot allowed the Assyrians to be lighter, faster and better prepared to outmaneuver other chariots and cavalry. Their terrifying bows could shoot arrows through enemy armor. Around 1000 BC the Assyrians invented the first chariot-mounted archer. Archers were mounted on their horses without reins. Because the reins were not yet invented, Assyrian archers fought their horses without reins.
ref: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots. Arrows from their deadly crossbows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. About 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry. A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses.

src: Bobilliklar xudolarining har biri uchun xudoning uyi deb hisoblangan asosiy ibodatxonani qurishgan. Insonlar xudolarga qurbonliklar keltirar, ruhoniylar marosimlar hamda bayramlar orqali mabudlarning ehtiyojlarini qanotlantirishga intilar edilar. Har bir ibodatxona ochiq hovli va faqat ruhoniylar kirishi mumkin bo'lgan ichki muqaddas xonaga ega bo'lgan. Ba'zi vaqtlarda zikkuratlar deb ataluvchi maxsus piramida shaklidagi minoralar ibodatxonalarning bir qismi sifatida qurilgan. Minoraning tepa qismi xudolar uchun maxsus muqaddas joy edi.
mt: Temples were built by each god for his own house. People brought sacrifices to the gods, priests performed rituals and celebrated festivals to satisfy the needs of the gods. Each temple had an open courtyard and an inner holy chamber accessible only to priests. Sometimes ziggurats, or special pyramidal towers, were built as part of the temples. The top of the tower was a special holy place for the gods.
ref: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god. People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples. The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.

src: "Ha! Ba'zida ""Qirol Tut"" yoki ""Qirol bolakay"" deb ham atalgan podshoh Tutanxamon hozirda eng taniqli bo'lgan qadimgi Misr shohlaridan biri. Qizig'I, u qadimgi vaqtlarda juda muhim deb hisoblanmagan hamda ko'pchilik qadimgi podshohlar ro'yxatlarida qayd etilmagan. Ammo 1922-yilda qabrining topilishi uni mashhur shaxsga aylantirdi. o'tmishning ko'plab qabrlari talon-taroj qilingan bo'lsa ham, bu qabrga deyarli tegilmagandi. Tutanxamon bilan birga ko'milgan narsalarning ko'pchiligi, jumladan qimmatli metallar va nodir toshlardan yasalgan minglab artefaktlar yaxshi saqlanib qolgan."
mt: "Ha! Sometimes the "King Tut" or "King Tut" is also known as the king Tutankhamun is one of the most famous ancient Egyptian kings. The interesting thing is that he was not considered very important in ancient times and was not listed in many ancient kings lists. But the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a famous person. Many tombs were looted in the past, but this tomb was almost untouched. Most of the things buried with Tutankhamun, including thousands of artifacts made of precious metals and rare stones, have been well preserved."
ref: "Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as ""King Tut"" or ""The Boy King"", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times. Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed. Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones."
